Policy: Planning Act 2008 (Cap. 29).
Policy_Content: This Act creates a new system of development permitting for nationally significant infrastructure projects. The new system covers certain types of energy, transport, water, waste water and waste projects. The Act establishes the Infrastructure Planning Commission, which will be responsible for examining applications for development consent for nationally significant infrastructure projects. The Commission may also confer upon developers certain rights for the purpose of facilitating a project. These rights may include the compulsory acquisition of land where there is a compelling case in the public interest. National policy statements will set the framework for decisions by the Commission.

Policy: Small Claims Tribunal Act 2008 (No. 20 of 2008).
Policy_Content: This Act establishes a Small Claims Tribunal, defines its jurisdiction and provides rules relative to proceedings of the Tribunal. The Tribunal shall have no jurisdiction in respect of any claim: (a) for the recovery of land or any estate or interest in any land; (b) in which the title to any land, or any estate or interest in any land is in question; (c) in which there is a dispute concerning the entitlement of any person under a will, or settlement, or on any intestacy (including a partial intestacy); (d) for any chiefly or other traditional or customary title.

Policy: Law on the Government of Republika Srpska.
Policy_Content: This Law sets provisions regarding the functioning and legal order of the Government of Republika Srpska. Executive power in the Republika Srpska, in accordance with the Constitution, is exercised by the Government of the Republika Srpska. The Government is independent within its competencies and is responsible for its work to the People's Party of National Assembly of the Republika Srpska. The seat of the Government is in Banja Luka (capital city). In the exercise of its proclaimed powers the Government implements policy, executes laws and other regulations of the National Assembly, and it is further responsible for the situation in the Republic and in all areas within its competence.

Policy: Programa Nacional de Alimentos: produciendo para el pueblo Alimentos para la Vida.
Policy_Content: El objetivo general del Programa Nacional de Alimentos es impulsar la generación de empleo, ingresos y el incremento de la producción, la productividad y la calidad de alimentos, mediante el suministro de servicios públicos estratégicos, efectivos y adecuados a lo largo de las cadenas de valor agroalimentarias y de consumo básico: arroz, frijol, maíz, sorgo y complementariamente de otros sistemas agropecuarios como carne (bovina, porcina y avícola), leche, cacao, café, frutas y verduras en un esfuerzo articulado que dinamice el sector rural, teniendo como eje central el protagonismo de los pequeños y medianos productores asociados. El Programa Nacional de Alimentos se inscribe dentro del contexto de políticas establecidas por el Gobierno de Reconciliación y Unidad Nacional. Se desprende en particular del Plan Nacional de Desarrollo Humano, de su Estrategia de la Revolución en el Sistema Agropecuario, Forestal y Rural, y de la Política de Desarrollo Rural Incluyente. El Plan Nacional de Alimentos se acompaña de manera integrada del Plan Nacional Forestal y del Plan Nacional Agroindustrial.

Policy: Directive 2008/98/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council on waste and repealing certain Directives.
Policy_Content: This Directive lays down measures to protect the environment and human health by preventing or reducing the adverse impacts of the generation and management of waste and by reducing overall impacts of resource use and improving the efficiency of such use. The Directive recalls the general environmental protection principles of precaution and sustainability, technical feasibility and economic viability, protection of resources as well as the overall environmental, human health, economic and social impacts. Member States shall take the necessary measures to ensure that waste management is carried out without endangering human health, without harming the environment and, in particular: (a) without risk to water, air, soil, plants or animals; (b) without causing a nuisance through noise or odours; and (c) without adversely affecting the countryside or places of special interest.

Policy: Regulation on transmission of information on air pollution.

Policy: Regulation on measurements related to exploitation of installations or devices.

Policy: Presidential Decree No. 19 on approval of the Statute of Shahdag National Park.
Policy_Content: The Shahdag National Park was established in the Quba Rayon, Qusar Rayon, İsmayilli Rayon, Qəbələ Rayon, Oğuz Rayon and Şamaxi Rayon administrative districts with the aims of environmental protection, sustainability, biodiversity conservation, protection of endangered species of wild fauna and flora, as well as protecting rare and unique natural areas, historical and cultural objects, creating conditions for tourism and recreation, developing scientific methods for environmental protection and ecological enlightenment, ensuring environmental monitoring and training of population in the field of environment. According to the Article 10/1 of the Law No. 840-IQ on protected areas the sanitary-protection zone in Shahdag National Park has been identified in order to protect soil and water areas from anthropogenic impacts. This National Park can be used for environmental monitoring, scientific research and recreational, educational and touristic purposes as long as being in compliance with the requirements established by the legislation.

Ce sont, entre autres, l’agriculture, la chasse et activités annexes (culture de céréales et autres cultures non classées ailleurs; culture de légumes, horticulture, pépinières ; culture de fruits, de noix, de plantes pour boisson ou épices ; élevage ; culture et élevage associés ; activités annexes à la culture et à l’élevage ; chasse, piégeage, repeuplement en gibier et activités annexes) ; la Sylviculture, exploitation forestière, activités annexes, la cueillette; activités annexes à la sylviculture et à l’exploitation Forestière ; pêche, pisciculture, aquaculture ; la fabrication de produits alimentaires et de boissons (abattage, transformation et conservation des viandes ; transformation et conservation des poissons, crustacés et mollusques ; transformation et conservation de fruits et légumes ; fabrication de corps gras ; fabrication de produits laitiers et de glaces ; travail des grains, fabrication des produits amylacés ; fabrication de produits alimentaires à base de céréales non classés ailleurs; fabrication de produits alimentaires non classés ailleurs) ; travail de cuir, fabrication d’articles de voyage et fabrication de chaussures ; sciage et rabotage du bois ; fabrication de produits agrochimiques, de peintures et d’autres produits chimiques ; captage, traitement et distribution d’eau ; restaurants. Tout commerçant qui désire s’installer sur le territoire national doit déclarer l’activité commerciale de son choix, conformément aux dispositions de la présente nomenclature.
Subject: General

Policy: National food security mid-term and long-term planning framework (2008-2020 ).
Policy_Content: This National Food Security Mid-term and Long-term Planning Framework (2008-2020 ) is a sectoral policy document at the national level. Objectives are:  (i)	 Stabilize grain-sown areas. By 2020, maintain arable land area at not less than 1.2 billion hectares. (ii) Ensure grain and other major food basically self-sufficient. Maintain grain self-sufficiency over 95%. (iii) Maintain a reasonable level of grain storage and the proportion of wheat and rice not less than 70% of the storage. (iv) Establish a modern grain logistic system; reduce grain distribution costs.

Policy: National Strategy for Sustainable Development - Horizons 2013-2020-2030.
Policy_Content: This National Strategy for Sustainable Development sets goals oriented towards the continuous improvement of living standards and relations in harmony with the natural environment. As a general guidance the document addresses the following strategic objectives in the short, medium and long term: Horizon 2013: to incorporate the principles and practices of sustainable development into all programs and policies of Romania as an EU member state. Horizon 2020: aims at reaching the current average level of EU countries on key indicators of sustainable development. Horizon 2030 significantly closes the gaps related to the average level in that year for the EU countries in terms of sustainable development indicators. Achieving these strategic objectives will ensure, medium and long term, high growth and, consequently, a significant reduction of social and economic disparities between Romania and other EU Member States (pags.1 and 2). Promoting equal opportunities in the labour market by facilitating women's access to traditionally male in leadership positions in politics, combating gender stereotypes, trafficking, domestic violence, sexual discrimination and harassment in the workplace, creating an inclusive labour market, providing special programmes for women including retraining for other occupations of persons employed in industries at risk of relocation (pag. 78).

Policy: Integrated Financing Strategy (IFS) for sustainable land management in Jordan.
Policy_Content: The Integrated Financing Strategy (IFS) is a national wide document, developed by the Ministry of Planning and International Cooperation in partnership with the Ministry of Environment, supported by the Global Mechanism (GM) of the UNCCD, to implement Jordan’s commitments towards UNCCD. The IFS aims at providing a comprehensive and coordinated approach to financing and project implementation that would combat desertification and promote SLM, and in doing so to provide a more stable climate for investment and financing in this area for Jordan. It represents an untraditional approach to funding based on a structured program-financing mechanism that rather than supporting independent activities, ensures that all elements are tied together to increase synergies and maximize the benefits of the final outcome. Thus, SLM and combating desertification are seen as part of the same scope, with poverty alleviation as one critical tool with which to mitigate land degradation. Furthermore, while helping to develop the appropriate blend of funds – namely internal, external and innovative – the strategy also uncovers potential barriers in resource identification, allocation, and disbursement. Once the chain of activities is identified, the required financial resources, both domestic and international, need to be assessed and mobilized. Within the Strategy, an Action Plan is elaborated to detail the activities for raising different financial resources and it should serve as the main reference for implementation of the Strategy.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Fisheries, Forestry, Land & soil, Water

Policy: Eritrean Petroleum Corporation Establishment Proclamation, No. 161 of 2008
Policy_Content: The law establishes the Eritrean Petroleum Corporation as a legal person. The objectives of the Corporation are to undertake and engage in petroleum operations, including exploration, development and production operations and exploitation of petroleum resources and marketing of the same. The Corporation is given powers to; invest in activities of petroleum operations; enter into joint investment undertakings with foreign natural or juridical persons in petroleum operations in consonance with the petroleum operations laws of Eritrea; provide necessary services to licensed natural or juridical persons engaged in petroleum operations; acquire real properties and/or import necessary equipment, machinery or facilities; perform and implement whatever necessary and legitimate investments; among others. The Corporation is charged to carry out its duties with compliance to petroleum operations, environmental protection and labour safety. The law provides for the administration, management and composition of the Corporation. The Ministry of Finance has the ultimate authority of overseeing the financial performance and pursuance of the implementation and realization of the objectives of the Corporation.

State support for agricultural production shall be granted to: (a) producers of agricultural commodities; (b) leasing organizations; (c) food processing and agricultural products and animal products processing organizations; (d) agricultural scientific and research institutions; and (e) organizations producing and processing flax. The main state support measures: (a) accessibility of credits; (b) insurance of agricultural risks; (c) purchase and renewal of work equipment; (d) extension; and (e) formation of regional food fund.

Policy: Politique de la ressource bois 2014
Policy_Content: La Politique de la Ressource Bois 2014 est un document sectoriel de la Suisse. La politique définit cinq objectifs: utiliser entièrement le potentiel de production de bois durablement exploitable des forêts suisses en s’appuyant sur une économie forestière performante; accroître la demande intérieure de produits en bois (bois-matière), en particulier celle portant sur les produits fabriqués à partir de bois issu de forêts domestiques; développer le bois-énergie, en veillant à une exploitation durable ainsi qu’à une valorisation efficace et propre; renforcer la capacité d’innovation de la filière bois; et faire en sorte, grâce à une coordination optimale, que la politique de la ressource bois contribue de façon importante à la réalisation des objectifs d’autres politiques sectorielles. Le plan d’action bois est destiné à garantir une mise en œuvre cohérente de la politique de la ressource bois. Il énonce les mesures prioritaires choisies ainsi que les groupes-cibles correspondants. Il définit également les prestations que l’Office fédéral de l’environnement (OFEV) apparaît devoir fournir pour aider à la réalisation des objectifs formulés. Les résultats positifs obtenus durant la première période du plan d’action (2009–2012) ont incité la direction de l’OFEV à le reconduire jusqu’à 2016.

Policy: Governmental Decree No. HG1210/2008 validating the Regulation on the Civil Council for Monitoring the Center for Combating Economic Crime and Corruption.
Policy_Content: This Regulation defines the basis for the functioning of the Civil Council for Monitoring the Center for combating economic crime and corruption, its organization, purpose, principles of activity, tasks, functions, rights and duties. The Civil Council is an independent and impartial representative group of civil society without the status of a legal entity, monitoring, evaluating and advising the Center for Combating Economic Crimes and Corruption by society. The purpose of the Civil Council shall be as follows: (a) public interest representation; (b) ensuring and developing interaction between the Center and society; (c) increasing the accountability of the Center to society; and (d) ensuring adherence to the principles of integrity, transparency, accountability and professionalism in the implementation of the activities of the Center. The Civil Council carries out its activities on the basis of the following principles: legality, independence, objectivity, impartiality, collegiality and transparency. The Civil Council performs the following functions: (a) monitoring the activities of the Center, including administrative, operational and personnel policy; (b) evaluation of the annual reports of the Center before they are sent to the Parliament, Government and the President of the Republic of Moldova; (c) assessing the performance of the Center against the targets set in its annual plan activities, with the development of recommendations for the next year; (d) agreeing on the draft estimate of the annual expenses of the Center and making recommendations when planning the budget before sending it to the Ministry of Finance; (e) quarterly informing the management of the Center and annually - the Government, Parliament and the President of the Republic of Moldova through reports on the control the activities of the Center and related recommendations;  and (f) acceptance of applications from citizens and their transmission to the competent authorities.
Subject: General

Policy: Regional Decree No. 1009 validating the Regulation and certificate         of natural protected area of regional significance “Nightingale grove”.
Policy_Content: Natural protected area of regional significance “Nightingale grove” has botanical significance (wild flora species included in the Red Book of the Russian Federation and in the regional Red Book), zoological significance (birds included in the Red Book of the Russian Federation and in the regional Red Book), hydrological significance (springs and water protection forests along the river Desna) and educational significance (ecological excursions). The following activities shall be prohibited in the reserve: (a) all types of forest felling, except for sanitary felling, maintenance felling, other felling for the arrangement and maintenance of ski trails and other sports and recreation facilities; (b) destruction and damage of trees and bushes, except for cases of sanitary felling, thinning, other felling for the arrangement and maintenance of ski trails and other sports and recreation facilities; (c) collection of plants for bouquets; (d) passage and parking of vehicles outside the roads and places designated for these purposes; (e) making fires and arranging picnics outside the designated areas; (f) construction of residential, industrial and other structures, except for structures related to the improvement of a natural monument and the maintenance of sports and recreation facilities; (g) plowing of land and destruction of soil cover; (h) all types of drainage, reclamation and other activities leading to a change in the hydrological regime; and (i) littering of the territory, storage and disposal of any waste. The following activities shall be authorized in the reserve: (a) excursions and ecological tourism; (b) sports and recreational activities; (c) conducting field studies with students and schoolchildren; (c) recreational fishing; (d) conducting scientific research and activities aimed at maintaining biological diversity; and (e) other types of activities that do not harm natural complexes and objects of the natural monument.

Policy: Ley Nº 18.047 – Sistema cooperativo.
Policy_Content: La presente ley tiene por finalidad regular la constitución, organización y funcionamiento de las cooperativas y del sector cooperativo, considerados como un instrument eficaz e importante para contribuir al desarrollo económico y social, al fortalecimiento de la democracia y a una más justa distribución de la riqueza. Las cooperativas quedan sujetas a los siguientes principios: 1) Libre adhesión y retiro voluntario de los socios; 2) Control y gestión democrática por los socios; 3)   Participación económica de los socios; 4) Autonomía e independencia; 5) Educación, capacitación e información cooperativa; 6) Cooperación entre cooperativas; 7) Compromiso con la comunidad. El Título II de la Ley introduce disposiciones específicas para cooperativas particulares, entre las cuales figuran las cooperativas agrarias (arts. 108-116). El Ministerio de Ganadería, Agricultura y Pesca fomentará la creación de cooperativas agrarias y dispondrá una amplia difusión a ese fin y desarrollará programas de capacitación cooperativa. El Estado deberá facilitar los medios y conceder todos los beneficios posibles para la exportación directa de los productos por las cooperativas agrarias.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development

Policy: Commercial Marine Navigation Code.
Policy_Content: This Code establishes legal, economic and organizational grounds for state regulation in the sphere of commercial marine navigation. It shall be applicable to navigation along the sea routes and in the inland waterways. Article 6 establishes that state management in the sphere shall be carried out by State Water Transport Authority in relation to marine navigation and by State Fisheries Authority in relation to fisheries management. Article 7 establishes that State Fisheries Authority shall carry out the following functions: (a) supervision of international agreements concluded by Turkmenistan in the sphere of fisheries; (b) state registration of fishing vessels; (c) piloting of fishing vessels in seaports; and (d) protection of marine environment. Article 29 entrusts State Fisheries Authority with the task of registration of fishing vessels. Article 81 establishes that piloting of vessels shall be carried out by state marine pilot with a view of ensuring safe navigation and environmental protection. Article 293 classifies the types of oil pollution from ships and establishes related liability.

Policy: Law of Georgia on Occupied Territories (No. 431-IIS of 2008)
Policy_Content: This Law aims to define the status of territories that have been occupied as a result of the military aggression by the Russian Federation, and to establish a special legal regime for these territories. For the purpose of this Law, the occupied territories and maritime zones ('the occupied territories') mostly covers the territories of the Autonomous Republic of Abkhazia; Tskhinvali region (the territories of the former South Ossetian Autonomous Region); and on the Black Sea: the inland waters and the territorial sea of Georgia, their bed and subsoil falling within the water area along the state border with the Russian Federation, to the South of the Psou River up to the administrative border at the influx of the Enguri River into the Black Sea, over which Georgia exercises its sovereignty, as well as the following maritime zones: the adjacent zone, the special economic zone, and the continental shelf, where, according to the norms of the legislation of Georgia and the international law, in particular the UN Convention on the Law of the Sea of 1982, Georgia exercises fiscal, sanitary, immigration and taxation rights in the adjacent zone, and sovereign rights and jurisdiction – within the special economic zone and on the continental shelf. The emergency rule and special legal regime shall apply to the occupied territories for the validity period of this Law. This implies restrictions on free movement, conducting economic activities, and concluding transactions regarding real property in the occupied territories and with respect to other issues defined under this Law. Any transaction regarding real property that is concluded within the occupied territories in violation of the legislation of Georgia shall be deemed void from the time of its conclusion and shall have no legal implications. The right of property within the occupied territories shall be protected and shall be regulated under the legislation of Georgia. Among others, the following activities shall be prohibited in the occupied territories: any economic (entrepreneurial or non-entrepreneurial) activity; international air and maritime traffic, except as provided for in the UN Convention on the Law of the Sea of 1982; railway and international overland traffic; and the use of public resources. Finally, the Law provides that the responsibility of the Russian Federation, as the state carrying out military occupation, to protect cultural heritage in the occupied territories shall be established under the norms and principles of international law.

Policy: Decreto Nº 256 - Ley de Desarrollo Forestal Sustentable para el Estado de Chiapas.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley del Estado de Chiapas regula y fomenta la protección, conservación, restauración, desarrollo, manejo, aprovechamiento, diversificación productiva, transformación, industrialización y comercialización de los recursos forestales, así como de los servicios ecosistémicos que estos generen dentro de su territorio. Estas disposiciones tienen por objetivos generales, entre otros, garantizar a los habitantes el derecho constitucional de gozar de un medio ambiente sano, como así también respetar el derecho al uso y disfrute preferente de los recursos forestales de los lugares que ocupan y habitan las comunidades indígenas en el Estado. Enter los objetivos específicos se contemplan los siguientes: a) propiciar la reconversión productiva de terrenos agrícolas y ganaderos en desuso, cuando se trate de terrenos de origen forestal o preferentemente forestal; b) prevenir y controlar la erosión de los suelos, y procurar su restauración; c) regular el manejo integral del fuego, la inspección y vigilancia, de plagas y enfermedades forestales.

Policy: Mining Code Act (No. 950 of 2009).
Policy_Content: This Act ensures the the exploitation of mineral deposits on land and sea are part of a sustainable development. It applies to stone, gravel, sand, clay, lime, chalk, peat, topsoil and similar minerals and does NOT apply to commodities covered by Act No. 960 on Danish subsoil exploitation (hydrocarbon, CO2). The Minister of Environment sets regulations on quality and quantity of raw materials used for construction, on the recycling thereof, on the quantity and quality of raw materials used for the manufacturing of industrial products, on the processing of certain raw material quality (abstraction) and on waste, replacement products and dredging materials from the Danish marine area to be recovered and recycled as raw material. Permission for these activities is required and is granted by the municipal council authorities. The county council performs a mapping of mineral deposits on land to which the Minister of Environment and Energy shall set regulations. Specific regulations are set for environmental damage in accordance with articles 7-11 of the Environmental Damage Act, whereby any land contamination as a result of a direct or indirect introduction of substances, organisms or microorganisms to soil or subsoil, result in a significant risk to human health.

Policy: Loi nº 08-22 portant Code forestier de la République centrafricaine.
Policy_Content: Le présent code et ses textes instituent un cadre juridique pour assurer la gestion du secteur forestier en République Centrafricaine. Dans cette perspective, il a vocation de : - concilier l’exploitation des produits forestiers avec les exigences de la conservation du patrimoine forestier et de la diversité biologique en vue d’un développement durable ; - assurer la conservation et la protection des formations végétales afin de permettre leur régénération ; - garantir la gestion durable des écosystèmes forestiers. Il établit les modalités d’attribution des permis d’exploitation et d’aménagement, les obligations sociales des sociétés forestières, les modalités d’exploitation des produits forestiers, le respect de l’équilibre écologique par la protection de certaines espèces forestières. Le Code contient 10 titres qui traitent successivement des dispositions générales (I) ; du domaine forestier permanent (II) ; non permanent(III); du classement et du déclassement des forêts (IV) ; de la gestion participative (V); de la promotion, transformation et commercialisation des produits forestiers(VI) ; de la fiscalité forestière (VII); de la répression des infractions  (VIII); des dispositions transitoires (IX) et finales (X)

Policy: Ley Nº 18.381 - Derecho de Acceso a la Información Pública.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley tiene por objeto promover la transparencia de la función administrativa de todo organismo público, sea o no estatal, y garantizar el derecho fundamental de las personas al acceso a la información pública. Se considera información pública toda la que emane o esté en posesión de cualquier organismo público, sea o no estatal, salvo las excepciones o secretos establecidos por ley, así como las informaciones reservadas o confidenciales. Policy: Montreal Protocol (Import/Export Licensing System of Controlled Substances) Regulations (Cap. 216A).
Policy_Content: These Regulations, made under section 10 of the  Montreal Protocol (Controlled Substances) Act, prohibit the importation of controlled substances listed in Annex A, B, C or E of the Montreal Protocol. Import, export or retail sale of certain substances may require registration with the National Ozone Unit. No person shall import any controlled substance from or export such substance to a country that is not a party to the Montreal Protocol as listed in the Fourth Schedule. The Minister may, on the recommendation of the Unit revoke a licence if a licensee: (a) exceeds a quota stipulated in the licence; (b) imports or exports a controlled substance not authorized by the licence. Controlled substances imported or exported in contravention of these Regulations shall be detained by the customs department. A licensee may appeal a decisions of the Unit to the Minister.

Policy: Economic Vision 2030 for Bahrain.
Policy_Content: This Economic Vision exposes the aspirations for Bahrain economy, government and society in accordance with the guiding principles of sustainability, competitiveness and fairness. Afterwards, the Government will develop detailed strategic and operational plans for making these aspirations a reality. The overall goal of the Vision is to shift from an economy built on oil wealth to a productive, globally competitive economy driven by the private sector, given that the aim will only be reached if the private sector, the government and every member of Bahraini society all work together to make it happen. The guiding principles of the Vision are as follows (i) Sustainability: economic growth must never come at the expense of the environment and the long-term well-being of the people, therefore efforts will be made to protect the environment and preserve the cultural heritage; (ii) Competitiveness: the need is for a continuously improving productivity to make Bahrain a great place to do business through high-quality public services, cutting-edge infrastructure and an appealing living environment; (iii) Fairness: the government shall provide the legal and regulatory framework that ensures protection of consumers and fair treatment for business owners, including foreign investors. The principles need to be translated into action, in particular in the following sectors (i) increasing economy; (ii) efficient and effective Government; and (iii) a socially assisted, high-educated, and environmentally safe society.

Policy: Regional Law No. 83-OZ “On protection of green plantations”.
Policy_Content: This Regional law shall be applicable to green plantations and, in particular, to recreational forests, urban forests, shrubbery, landscape green plantations and forest parks. Compensation greening shall be intended artificial and natural reproduction of plant species, including tree species and shrubbery species, and also urban afforestation and reforestation (art. 3). Natural and legal persons shall be granted the following rights: (a) use of green plantations for cultural, educational, recreational purposes, sport and tourism; (b) participation in public discussions on issues related to protection of green plantations; and (c) submittal to public administration of complaints and proposals related protection of green plantations (art. 8). General registration of plant species and plantations shall be carried out at least once in 10 years, the data shall be inserted in the state register of plant species and plantations and shall be made accessible to public within six month after the completion of registration procedure (art. 10). Planting of green plantations shall include: (a) selection of plots of land destined for planting; (b) purchase and growing of planting material; and (c) planting (art. 12).

Ecological education of the population shall include: (a) information of the population on adopted and drafted on environmental and ecological legislative acts; (b) dissemination and promulgation of ecological knowledge; (c) organization of conferences, lectures and seminars; and (d) publication of ecological literature (art. 8).

The physical or legal persons or the local government units may submit at the Ministry of Environment, Forests and Water Administration the request for the removal of certain parts from the pastures fund. The request should be accompanied by a formal notice, a copy of the permission or document that approves the activities proposed to be undertaken, and the blue print of the area. The request should be examined within 30 days of its submission.

Policy: Arrêté n°00640.08/MEFEPA du 8 octobre 2008 fixant les modalités d’attribution des concessions forestières par adjudication.
Policy_Content: Le présent arrêté fixe les modalités d'attribution des concessions forestières par adjudication. L'attribution des concessions forestières par adjudication est faite sur appel d'offres public. Toute personne physique ou morale, légalement établie sur le territoire national peut soumissionner pour l'acquisition de lots objet de l'appel d'offres public. L'adjudication est portée à la connaissance du public par le ministère de l'Economie Forestière, au moins 15 jours à l'avance, par avis dans la presse et affichage aux bureaux des inspections provinciales, des cantonnements et des préfectures. Cet avis indique notamment le nombre de lots, leur localisation ainsi que la procédure de retrait et de dépôt des dossiers. A la publication  de la liste  d'appel d'offres annonçant la mise en adjudication des lots, un cahier de clauses contractuelles mentionnant les obligations spécifiques de chacun des lots est mis à la disposition des soumissionnaires potentiels.

Policy: Regional Decree No. 320-pa validating the Regulation on regional state nature biological reserve “Tundrovy”.
Policy_Content: Regional state nature biological reserve “Tundrovy” shall be constituted for an indefinite time period with a view of protection of migratory bird species on plots of protection forest of regional significance. It shall perform the following functions: (a) conservation of natural ecosystems; (b) protection of nesting and resting grounds of migratory waterfowl and other migratory bird species; (c) conservation and protection of rare and endangered wild fauna and wild flora species and natural habitats thereof; (d) protection of traditional natural habitat of wild reindeer; (e) protection of precious game, i.e. wild fauna species and birds, including migratory routes and traditional habitats thereof; and (f) conservation and protection of traditional forest areas, taiga and tundra landscapes. The following activities shall be prohibited: (a) ploughing up; (b) resin tapping, haymaking, passage and grazing of cattle; (c) commercial hunting and all types of hunting of rare and endangered species; (d) lease of forest for any type of activity except for recreation; (e) any type of felling, except for sanitary felling, and timber extraction; and (f) collection of eggs and destruction of nests and burrows.

Policy: Ordinance on conservation and development of mountainous areas.
Policy_Content: The present Ordinance implements the Forestry Act of 25 March 1991, Agriculture Act of 11 December 2008 and the Act on protection of nature and landscape conservation of 23 May 1996. Article 1 establishes that the objectives of the integral and sustainable development of mountain areas are to: a) conserve and promote the mountain areas as living space and economic area, as well as recreation area for the population; b) conserve and promote living space of native plants and wild animals in mountainous areas in their extension and quality; c) conserve the mountain regions as raw material source and manufacturing base, especially for alpine farming, forestry and tourism; d) direct the development, form and intensity of exploitation in mountain regions complying with nature, landscape and the environment. The texte consists of 18 articles divided into 5 Parts as follows: General provisions (I); Measures (II); Organization and procedures (III); Financing (IV); Final provisions (V). Two Annexes are enclosed.

Policy: Regional Law No. 69-OZ “On some issues of turnover of agricultural land”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates some issues of turnover of agricultural land and shares thereof in common property, and also the issues of classification of agricultural land as high-yielding agricultural land. It establishes minimum consolidated land plots of agricultural land as of 1,9 ha, and for drained agricultural land – 1 ha. It envisages expropriation of agricultural land plot in case of non-purposeful use thereof by the owner for the period of three years. Agricultural organizations and farmers can purchase in ownership agricultural land pertaining thereto on condition of permanent (open-ended) tenancy and hereditary possession at a price equal to 20 percent of cadastre value thereof. High-yielding agricultural land shall be classified land yielding more than 20 percent higher than average regional index.

Policy: Arrêté du 26 septembre 2008 modifiant l'arrêté du 24 octobre 2003 relatif à la commercialisation des matériels forestiers de reproduction.
Policy_Content: Le premier paragraphe de l'article 1er de l'arrêté du 24 octobre 2003  relatif aux conditions de récolte des matériels forestiers de reproduction dans les matériels de base admis en catégorie identifiée est remplacé par le texte suivant "La récolte de semences dans des sources de graines admises au registre national en catégorie identifiée est autorisée sous réserve du respect des dispositions suivantes  - les zones de récoltes doivent comprendre un ou plusieurs ensembles d'arbres bien répartis et suffisamment nombreux pour assurer une interfécondation satisfaisante et éviter les effets défavorables de la consanguinité. La récolte d'arbres isolés (des arbres de parc notamment) et d'alignements (en particulier des haies bocagères ou des plantations de faible largeur en bord de route) n'est pas autorisée. Pour le cas particulier du cormier, les récoltes sur arbres d'alignements et sur arbres isolés sont autorisées jusqu'au 30 juin 2014, à condition qu'au moins 20 arbres soient récoltés, puis les graines de ces arbres mélangées, afin que le lot de graines puisse être certifié;.- les individus récoltés doivent clairement présenter une adaptation aux conditions écologiques prévalant dans la région de provenance;.- les individus récoltés doivent être indemnes d'attaques d'organismes nuisibles et présenter une bonne résistance aux conditions pédoclimatiques défavorables de la station où ils poussent, sans qu'il soit tenu compte des dommages éventuels causés par la pollution".

Policy: Constitution of Turkmenistan.
Policy_Content: Turkmenistan is a democratic, legal and secular state in which the government takes the form of presidential republic (Article 1). The property is inviolable. Turkmenistan approves the right to private ownership of the means of production, land and other material and intellectual values. They can also belong to the associations of citizens and the state. The law establishes objects that are exclusive property of the state. The state guarantees equal protection and creation of equal conditions for development of all forms of ownership. Confiscation of property is prohibited, except for the property acquired by means prohibited by law. Forced confiscation of property is permissible only in cases stipulated by law (Article 9). The Constitution consists of 117 Articles divided into VIII Sections: Fundamentals of the Constitutional System of Turkmenistan (I); Rights, Freedoms and Duties of the citizens of Turkmenistan (II); The System of Government and Administration in Turkmenistan (III); Local Self-Government (IV); Election System, Referendum (V); Judiciary (VI); The Prosecutor’s Office (VII); and Final Provisions (VIII). The state is responsible for safeguarding the national historical and cultural heritage, natural environment, ensuring equality between social and ethnic communities. The state encourages scientific and artistic creativity and distribution of its positive results, promotes development of international relations in the fields of science, culture, education and training, sports and tourism (Article 11). Turkmenistan guarantees the equality of rights and freedoms of individual and citizen, and also the equality of the individual and citizen before the law regardless of their nationality, race, gender, origin, property and official status, place of residence, language, religion, political beliefs, party affiliation or lack of affiliation to any party (Article 19). Men and Women in Turkmenistan have equal civil rights. Violation of equality on the basis of gender is punishable by law (Article 20). Everyone has the right to favourable environment. The State supervises the management of natural resources in order to protect and improve living conditions, as well as environmental protection and regeneration (Article 36). Gengeshes (local self-government): 1) Determine the basic directions of economic, social and cultural development of their territories; 2) Create and approve the budget and report on its performance; 3) Establish local taxes and the manner of their charging; 4) Define measures for rational use of natural resources and environmental protection; 5) Deal with other issues assigned by law to them. The decisions taken by Gengeshes within the limits of their competence are binding in their territory (Article 86).

Policy: Mining Amendment Act 2008.

Policy: Regional Law “On apiculture”.
Policy_Content: The scope of this Regional law shall be creation of the conditions for bee raising regarding honey bees (Apis mellifera), use thereof for pollination of agricultural entomophilous plants, obtaining apiculture products, protection of honey bees, improvement of apiculture efficiency and safeguarding rights and legal interests of natural and legal persons carrying out bee raising activity (arts. 1- 2). Bee farmers shall be authorized to carry out bee raising either for individual personal needs or as entrepreneurial activity. Bee farmers shall have the following rights: (a) place stationary apiaries on land plots in their ownership, lease or tenancy; (b) place mobile apiaries by written consent granted by owners, leaseholders or tenants of agricultural land, forest land or urban land irrespectively of the place of registration of bee families; (c) require state support; (d) obtain veterinary assistance; (e) obtain information of state of environment and risks for bees from state bodies; and (f) set up beekeepers associations (art. 4). The number of bee families in private or other apiaries shall not be subject to limitation (art. 5).

Policy: Decreto Supremo Nº 020-2008-AG ─ Reglamento del Decreto Legislativo Nº 994, que promueve la inversión privada en proyectos de irrigación para la ampliación de la frontera agrícola.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto Supremo aprueba el Reglamento que establece las normas que regulan el procedimiento para la promoción de la inversión privada en proyectos de irrigación de tierras eriazas con aptitud agrícola de propiedad del Estado, conforme a lo establecido por el Decreto Legislativo Nº 994. Las tierras eriazas con aptitud agrícola son tierras no explotadas por falta o exceso de agua y los demás terrenos improductivos que sean de dominio del Estado. No se consideran tierras eriazas con aptitud agrícola: 1) Las tierras que se encuentran comprendidas dentro de las Áreas Naturales Protegidas; 2) Las tierras que constituyan patrimonio arqueológico de la Nación; 3) Las tierras destinadas a la defensa o seguridad nacional; 4) Las tierras de protección; 5) Las tierras que se encuentren dentro de los planos aprobados para fines de expansión urbana y las incluidas en el inventario de tierras con fines de vivienda, de conformidad con lo previsto en las normas de la materia; 6) Las tierras forestales y aquéllas con capacidad de uso mayor forestal, incluidos los bosques primarios y secundarios y los declarados como de producción permanente; 7) Las tierras ribereñas al mar que se rigen con arreglo a su normatividad; 8) Los cauces, riberas y fajas marginales de los ríos, arroyos, lagos, lagunas, humedales y vasos de almacenamiento; 9) Las lomas y praderas con pastos naturales dedicados a la ganadería, aún cuando su uso fuese de carácter temporal.

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 1397 on some issues of transboundary movement of waste.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree establishes the modalities of the issuance of permits for export and import of waste by the Ministry of Natural Resources and Environmental Protection. The aforesaid permit shall be issued for once-only transboundary movement or for multiple transboundary movements if waste materials have the same physical and chemical qualities or being moved by the same person. A new permit shall be issued upon expiration of permit currently in force. The applicant shall submit the following documentation: (a) certificate of payment of state dues and taxes; (b) service certificate; (c) state registration certificate (for individual entrepreneurs); and (d) identity paper. This Decree shall be also applicable to transboundary movement of ozone depleting substances authorized for export and import in conformity with permits issued by the Ministry of Natural Resources and Environmental Protection.

Policy: Law No. 575-VI “On Agricultural Census”.
Policy_Content: The present Law shall identify legal, organizational and economic principles for preparing and carrying out the agricultural census, processing, summarizing, disseminating, and using its results, as well as shall regulate the relations of subjects of the agricultural census, identify their rights, obligations and responsibility, establish state guarantees with respect to the protection of confidential information that was obtained in the process of carrying out the agricultural census. Article 1 of the present Law shall specify that the agricultural census shall be a periodical state statistical observation that shall include collecting data that, as of the established date, describe the condition and structure of the agriculture, phenomena and processes in this sector, as well as processing, summarizing, disseminating, and using its results. According to Article 3 of the present Law, the goals of carrying out the agricultural census shall be: (a) to obtain integral, objective and reliable data as regards various parameters of the agricultural sector; (b) to receive summarized data for analyzing the dynamics of the main indicators of agricultural activities carried out by respondents and to ensure the carrying out of state statistical observations and the relevant calculations in the period between agricultural censuses; (c) to determine structural changes in agriculture for the purpose of providing informational support to management, forecasting social and economic development and developing government policies in this sector; and (d) to receive data on small territorial units and detailed combinational groupings of structural features of subjects of agricultural activities for the purpose of developing, at the local and regional levels, measures aimed at social and economic development of the relevant territories.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Black Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA

Policy: Ordinance No. 17/PMO of the Prime Minister on the enhancement of forestry management, protection, and coordination in forestry and wood business.
Policy_Content: This Ordinance, consisting of 29 sections, establishes the enhancement of forestry management, protection, and coordination in forestry and wood business. It aims at the following activities: implementation of the forestry development strategy from now until 2020, especially making up the forestry coverage of 70% of the country’s total area; limiting a reliance on an exploration of natural wood as a mean to generate income and moving toward shutting down the natural forest in principal at the appropriate time in order to preserve forestry resources and biodiversity. Implementation of the legislation related to forestry sector and wood business management. Increase a leading role of ministries and relevant government and local authorities at every level in pursuing its function, rights and obligations concerning the management of the forest and wood business effectively, and to resist and prevent illegal activity in violating forestry legislation.

Policy: Cabinet Regulation No. 784 of 2008 on Procedures for the Contained Use of Genetically Modified Micro-organisms, Issuance of a Permit and Cancelling Thereof
Policy_Content: The Regulation prescribes the notification procedures for the contained use of genetically modified micro-organisms; the procedures for the issuance of a permit for contained use and cancelling thereof; the duties and rights of supervisory and control authorities; the duties, rights and liabilities of science establishments; the risk assessment of contained use; the safety criteria for genetically modified micro-organisms; and the general principles for work with genetically modified micro-organisms. The Regulation does not apply to contained use activities, if the genetically modified micro-organisms utilised therein comply with the safety criteria referred to in Chapter 7 of this Regulation and the referred-to criteria have been published in the Official Journal of the European Communities; genetically modified organisms which may deliberately be released in conformity with the laws and regulations regarding deliberate release of genetically modified organisms; and food and animal feed permitted to be distributed in accordance with European Parliament and Council Regulation (EC) No. 1829/2003 of 22 September 2003 on genetically modified food and feed.

Policy: Cabinet Regulation No. 783 on By-law of the Supervision Council for Genetically Modified Organisms
Policy_Content: The Regulation adopts the by-law of the Supervision Council for Genetically Modified Organisms. The Council is a consultative institution, which co-ordinates the development of the national biosafety system policy. The Council performs the functions prescribed by the Law on Circulation of Genetically Modified Organisms and other regulatory enactments regarding the area of the circulation of genetically modified organisms. It has the following tasks: to analyse the situation of biosafety in the State; to submit proposals and recommendations in regard to the regulatory enactment system in the area of the circulation of genetically modified organisms; and to participate in the determination of issues of national interest in the area of genetically modified organisms, which are related to the legislative drafts of the European Union.

To enable Ministries, government Organizations as well as local Authorities at various levels to strengthen the lead in exercising their mandate, rights and duties regarding the management of forest and forestry business in a more effective and efficient manner, preventing and stopping violations of related laws and legislations.

Policy: Order No. 34 of the Ministry o Ecology and Natural Resources validating the Instruction on calculation of damages to green belts of urban and rural areas.

Policy: Lettre de Politique Foncière.
Policy_Content: Cette Lettre indique les orientations du gouvernement burundais pour organiser certains aspects de l’accès à la terre et à ses ressources naturelles, en particulier l’appropriation de la terre et la sécurisation des droits y afférant. Elle précise et complète d’autres notes stratégiques et textes relatifs à la gestion des terres, notamment dans les domaines de l’aménagement du territoire, de l’urbanisme ou de l’environnement. La Lettre de Politique Foncière entend répondre à l’absence de concertation entre les acteurs publics de la gestion des droits sur les sols, que ces sols soient urbains ou ruraux. Elle est le fruit d’une large consultation menée sur l’ensemble des communes du pays. En tant que cadre stratégique destiné à assurer la cohérence des interventions publiques, la Lettre de Politique Foncière s’adresse aux élus, aux acteurs du développement économique et aux partenaires techniques et financiers del’Etat burundais. Il s’agit d’un document public, accessible à tous et facilement consultable.

Policy: Arrêté du 12 septembre 2008 portant approbation de la modification de la convention constitutive de l'Agence française pour le développement et la promotion de l'agriculture biologique, groupement d'intérêt public.
Policy_Content: L'agence BIO a pour objet le développement et la promotion de l'agriculture biologique. L'agence BIO favorise les synergies entre les membres du groupement et l'expression de chacun. Elle est le lieu privilégié de l'analyse transversale interfilières et interprofessionnelle. Elle s'attache à favoriser l'émergence et le développement de démarches de type interprofessionnel, l'organisation économique et la coopération active avec l'ensemble des interprofessions, en particulier leur section bio. L'agence BIO exerce les missions suivantes :- information et promotion de l'agriculture biologique auprès du grand public, des professionnels de l'agriculture et de l'ensemble de la filière agroalimentaire; - développement de l'Observatoire national de l'agriculture biologique, en favorisant le lien avec les dynamiques mises en oeuvre dans les autres pays ou instances internationales; - analyse des filières, des marchés et des dynamiques interprofessionnelles en vue d'une meilleure structuration du secteur. Ces travaux sont menés en coordination avec ceux des sections consacrées aux produits issus de l'agriculture biologique dans les interprofessions et les offices; - mise en œuvre d'actions en faveur de la structuration des filières issues de l'agriculture biologique; - sur la thématique environnement et territoires, approfondissement de la connaissance: - des effets environnementaux et territoriaux de l'agriculture biologique; - des liens entre les acteurs de l'agriculture biologique (structures agricoles et entreprises d'aval) et la dynamique du tissu rural dans lequel ils s'insèrent. Tout en développant des compétences propres, l'agence BIO veille au développement des synergies et à la mobilisation des compétences de l'ensemble des partenaires professionnels ou institutionnels. L'agence BIO formule des avis aux ministres ou instances concernés, en particulier en matière d'orientation, de suivi et d'évaluation des actions menées dans le cadre de son objet.

Policy: National Integrated Water Resources Management Policy (Including Climate Change) for Belize.
Policy_Content: This Policy is the latest attempt to finalize a national water resources management policy using an integrated approach. The policies spelt out cover more than just freshwater and its previous attempts did not give major consideration to the impact of Global Climate Change on the water resources of Belize. This revision of the policy proposals gives major consideration to the impact of climate changes. The Caribbean Community Climate Change Centre has issued a contract for a consultancy for “Finalization of a National Integrated Water Resources Management Policy (Including Climate Change). Policy: Regional Law No. 802-OZ “On ensuring fertility of agricultural land”.
Policy_Content: The scope of this Regional Law shall be to ensure fertility of agricultural land by owners, landlords, land tenants and leaseholders. The main arrangements for ensuring soil fertility shall be: (a) elaboration and realization of regional programs; (b) soil, agrochemical, phytosanitary, ecological and toxicological inspection; (c) investments in soil conservation and reproduction; and (d) improvement of soil quality and fertility. Owners, tenants and leaseholders of agricultural land must: (a) prevent soil pollution, littering and degradation; (b) carry out agricultural production by methods ensuring reproduction of soil fertility and preventing negative environmental impact; (c) inform authorized institutions of soil pollution and degradation of agricultural land; and (d) not apply ecologically hazardous fertilizers, ameliorators and pesticides.Ensuring fertility of agricultural lands shall be based on the following main principles: (a) priority ensuring the fertility of agricultural land in the process of performance by possessors, owners, land users, including tenants, of economic activity; (b)  ensuring rational use and comprehensive protection of agricultural land; (c) reproduction of fertility of agricultural land; and (d) rate setting for the fertility of agricultural land.
Subject: Land & soil

Policy: Regulation on certification of crop seeds.
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Regulation is to ensure the cultivation of high quality seeds used for the production of agricultural commodities as well as for trade thereof. This Regulation shall be applicable to seeds subject to certification in the Kyrgyz Republic. This Regulation shall not be applicable to seeds used or intended to be used for scientific research or experimental purposes; used or intended for use for breeding new varieties; and not subject to certification. Certification shall be performed by authorized body of inspection and approbation of seeds and planting material. Certification body of state control on approbation of seeds and planting material, is obliged in accordance with the established procedure to register in the State Inspectorate for Standardization and Metrology under the Government of the Kyrgyz Republic (Kyrgyzstandart) certification systems and marks of conformity. Varieties that have undergone two years of testing in the state network and distinguished by yields and quality indicators in specific soil and climatic conditions are included in the State Register of Zoning of Varieties of the Kyrgyz Republic and shall be subsequently recommended for the relevant regions of the Kyrgyz Republic. Seeds of cereals subject to certification must meet the requirements for variety typicality and purity. The body exercising state control over approbation of seed and planting material, carries out control of seed crops at certain stages of plant development in order to determine their compliance. Selected seed samples should be packaged in such a way that during transportation thereof they are not damaged. Seed moisture samples are packaged in moisture-proof containers. A label with complete and accurate information about sed quality is placed on or attached to the package.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Cultivated plants

Les travaux légers et salubres autorisés pour les personnes âgées de moins de 18 ans sont les suivants: récolte de semences, de feuilles et de fruits à l'exception de bananes et de noix de palme, pour autant que le travail de cueillette s'effectue sur le sol; égrenage manuel de fruits et semences, triage de produits végétaux; confection de liens pour pépinières; vannerie; garde de petit bétail et de bassecour; surveillance exercée par les plantons grooms, portiers et sentinelles de jour; vente de journaux et colportage ne comportant pas le transport de marchandises pondéreuses; ou travaux qui seront autorisés par l'Inspecteur du ressort.

Policy: PCB Regulations (SOR/2008-273).
Policy_Content: The present Regulations enforce the Canadian Environmental Protection Act 1999 (S.C. 1999, c. 33). The purpose of the Regulations is to improve the protection of Canada’s environment and the health of Canadians by minimizing the risks posed by the use, storage and release of polychlorinated biphenyls (PCBs) and by accelerating the elimination of these substances. The text consists of 48 sections divided into 5 Parts. Part 1 sets out general requirements that are applicable to all parts of the Regulations. Part 2 establishes prohibitions on the release, manufacture, export, import, offer for sale, sale, processing and use of PCBs and products containing PCBs, and lists exceptions to these prohibitions; and sets deadlines to end the use of PCBs and products containing PCBs and send them for destruction. Part 3 specifies storage requirements for PCBs and products containing PCB s that are not processed daily or used; and sets deadlines to end the storage of PCBs and products containing PCBs and send them for destruction. Part 4 concerns labelling, record-keeping and reporting requirements for PCBs and products containing PCBs in order to track the progress of ending the use and storage of PCBs and products containing PCBs, and to track their destruction; and finally Part 5 deals with repeals and coming into force.
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy: Decree No.2 of Ministry of Environmental Protection laying down the List of Construction Projects for Category Management of Environmental Impact Assessments
Policy_Content: This Decree aims to exercise category management of EIA of construction projects based on the extent of impact construction projects will have on the environment. The List is formulated in accordance with Article 16 of the Environmental Impact Assessment Law. In line with provisions of the List, construction agencies shall undertake the responsibility of preparing environmental impact statement (EIS) and environmental impact form (EIF) or filling in environmental impact registration form. The nature and extent of sensitivity of the environment where construction projects are located are major basis for determining the category of EIA. EIA category of cross-sector and comprehensive construction projects shall be determined according to the highest level of individual indicators. For construction projects not included in the name list, the EIA category shall be proposed by provincial environmental protection department to the competent national environmental protection authority under the State Council for approval according to the characteristics of pollution factors and ecological influence factors of the projects as well as the nature and extent of sensitivity of the environment that the projects are located in.

Policy: Decreto Supremo Nº 014-2008-JUS ─ Reglamento de la Ley Nº 26872, Ley de Conciliación.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto Supremo aprueba el Reglamento de la de Ley de Conciliación, que regula el funcionamiento del sistema conciliatorio a nivel nacional establecido en la Ley Nº 26872 y sus disposiciones complementarias, transitorias y finales. Los principios que rigen la Conciliación se sujetan a lo siguiente: a) Principio de equidad: en el procedimiento conciliatorio se velará por el respeto del sentido de la justicia aplicada al caso particular, materia de Conciliación. El Conciliador está obligado a generar condiciones de igualdad para que los conciliantes puedan lograr acuerdos mutuamente beneficiosos. b) Principio de veracidad: la veracidad está dirigida a la búsqueda de lo querido realmente por las partes. El Conciliador no alterará nunca el sentido o significado de los hechos, temas, intereses o acuerdos a que arriben éstas en el procedimiento conciliatorio. c) Principio de buena fe: que se entiende como la necesidad que las partes procedan de manera honesta y leal, confiando en que esa será la conducta a seguir en el procedimiento conciliatorio. d) Principio de confidencialidad: la información derivada del procedimiento conciliatorio es confidencial, y no debe ser revelada a persona ajena a las negociaciones, sin el consentimiento de quien proporcionó dicha información. e) Principio de imparcialidad: el conciliador no debe identificarse con los intereses de las partes, quien tiene el deber de colaborar con los participantes sin imponer propuesta de solución alguna. f) Principio de neutralidad: el Conciliador debe abstenerse de conocer los casos en los que participan personas vinculadas a él o su entorno familiar, al personal del Centro de Conciliación, o en los que participen conciliantes con los cuales lo vincule parentesco, salvo que las partes soliciten expresamente la intervención de aquél. g) Principio de legalidad: la actividad conciliatoria se enmarca dentro de lo establecido en la Ley y Reglamento, en concordancia con el ordenamiento jurídico. h) Principio de celeridad: la función conciliatoria debe ejercerse permitiendo a las partes la solución pronta y rápida de su conflicto. i) Principio de economía: el procedimiento conciliatorio está orientado a que las partes ahorren tiempo y costos que les demandaría involucrarse en un proceso judicial.

Policy_Content: El presente Decreto Supremo modifica el que reglamenta parcialmente la Ley Nº 28687, con la finalidad de evitar demoras en la ejecución de los procesos de formalización, dotando de mayor eficacia a dichos procedimientos. Respecto a los Instrumentos de Formalización y en lo específico al Título de Saneamiento de Propiedad, que es el instrumento emitido para dar validez y eficacia a los títulos de propiedad otorgados por otras entidades que tuvieron competencia en materia de formalización y que presentan deficiencias que impiden su inscripción en el Registro de Predios. También procede extender estos títulos para acceder a la inscripción registral de transmisiones o transferencias realizadas por particulares, en el marco de la formalización de la propiedad. Los procesos de formalización que no hubieran concluido a la fecha de entrada en vigencia de la Ley, continuarán su trámite ante la entidad a cargo del proceso de formalización, hasta concluir con la formalización individual, conforme al marco legal vigente a esa fecha, pudiendo aplicarse las normas contenidas en el presente Reglamento.

Policy_Content: This Law establishes legal basis for the relations originating from the process of exploration, mining, extraction of hydrocarbons and other oil works, and is aimed at ensuring rational management of hydrocarbons. Agency on Hydrocarbons shall be the authorized state institution in the sphere of management and utilization of hydrocarbon resources (Art. 4). The following activities shall be subject to compulsory licensing: (a) exploration – period of validity 6 years; (b) mining – period of validity 20 years; and (c) combined exploration and mining – for the period comprehending period of validity of exploration licence and the period of validity of mining licence, including possible renewal periods (Art. 9). Any oil works shall be regulated by the following types of contracts or agreements: (a) product-sharing agreement; (b) concession contract on condition of royalty and tax; (c) joint-venture agreement; and (d) risk service contract (Art. 21). The Act consists of 11 Sections divided into 64 articles: (1) general provisions; (2) competence of the Cabinet of Ministers; (3) licensing; (4) contracts; (5) oil exploration and extraction; (6) rights, duties and liability of contractor and operator; (7) pipelines; (8) environmental protection, ensuring safety of the population and protection of public health; (9) financing and taxation; (10) legal terms and conditions; and (11) conclusive provisions. Ensuring environmental protection arrangements, safety of the population and the protection of public health shall be mandatory for contractor (Art. 42).
Subject: Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Asia, Caspian Sea, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia
Entry into force notes: This Law enters into force on the date of its official publication.

Policy: Regional Law No. 105-Z “On plenary powers of state bodies and local government in the sphere of land relations”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes plenary powers and jurisdictional competence of state bodies and local government in the sphere of land relations. Regional Government shall be responsible for management of public land plots and also of land plots with undelimited ownership, expropriation of land for public needs, application of public servitude and application to land areas the status of protected areas. Local government shall be responsible for cadastre registration of land within the boundaries of municipal units, auction sale of municipal land in ownership or allotment on lease and establishment of minimum and maximum land areas allotted for smallholding and farming.

It indicates: (i) the tasks of the Ministry, in particular relating to policies preparation, research in agricultural and livestock fields aiming at improving standards of production (also encouraging plans aiming at land reclamation and increment of the agricultural area in the total area of the State), enabling the good use of genetic resources, quarantine measures, market and storage rules, forestry and pasture, use regulation and maintenance of irrigation systems, rural development plans; (ii) the tasks of the representatives of the Ministry under the supervision of the Minister; (iii) composition and powers of the Board of Directors; (iv) the organizational structure of the Ministry; (v) tasks and functions of the different public administrations, divided in: Agricultural production development, Agricultural services, Irrigation and agricultural land reclamation, and other support departments.

Policy: Law No. 200 on environmental fees for the use of wild fauna and wild flora species.
Policy_Content: This Law establishes that payers of environmental fees for the use of wild fauna and wild flora species shall be natural and legal persons, including foreigners. Rates of environmental fees shall be subject to revision at least once in three years. Environmental fees for the use of wild fauna species, including fishes and other aquatic biological resources, shall be established in accordance with the Annex 1. Basic rates contained in the Annex 1 shall be used for the calculation of environmental fees for the use of wildlife objects for other purposes, specified in the Law on wildlife. Environmental fees for the use of wildlife objects shall not be applicable in the following cases: (a) protection of public health, prevention of diseases of agricultural and domestic animals, regulation of number of harmful animals; and (b) reproduction, stock enhancement and captive breeding of animals for scientific purposes.

Policy: National Plan of Action For the Control of Land-Based Sources of Marine Pollution in Belize.
Policy_Content: This National Plan of Action, based on the Global Program of Action to protect the marine environment from land-based activities, is developed through a collaborative and participatory approach between government agencies, local institutions and private sector in partnership with the U.S. National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA)-GPA Program Office. It sets out in detail the hydrological conditions of Belize, institutional and legal framework, biodiversity and other elements of importance to implementation of the NPA. The main body of the NPA identifies sources of point and non-point pollution of waters that impact also on marine pollution and specifies objectives and actions in respect to these sources in order of priority: sewage, nutrients (principally caused by agriculture and aquaculture), physical alteration & destruction of habitat (principally caused by urbanization & development, deforestation, agriculture & aquaculture), solid waste management. It also provides for a financing strategy for the implementation.

Policy: Ley Nº 20.285 - Sobre acceso a la información pública.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley aprueba la Ley de transparencia de la función pública y de acceso a la información de la Administración del Estado, la que regula el principio de transparencia en la función pública, el derecho de acceso a la información de los órganos de la Administración del Estado, los procedimientos para el ejercicio del derecho y para su amparo, y las excepciones a la publicidad de la información. En virtud del principio de transparencia de la función pública, se establece que los actos y resoluciones de los órganos de la Administración del Estado, sus fundamentos, los documentos que les sirvan de sustento o complemento directo y esencial, y los procedimientos que se utilicen para su dictación, serán públicos, salvos las excepciones que establece la Ley. Entre otras cosas, la Ley obliga a los órganos de la Administración del Estado a mantener en sus sitios web información permanente y actualizada, al menos una vez al mes, de antecedentes tales como: estructura orgánica, facultades, personal, información sobre el presupuesto, resultados de auditorías, etc. Además, establece que toda persona tiene derecho a solicitar y recibir información de cualquier órgano de la Administración del Estado. La Ley de transparencia de la función pública y de acceso a la información de la Administración del Estado también crea el Consejo para la Transparencia, una corporación autónoma de derecho público, con personalidad jurídica y patrimonio propio, el que tendrá por objeto promover la transparencia de la función pública, fiscalizar el cumplimiento de las normas sobre transparencia y publicidad de la información de los órganos de la Administración del Estado, y garantizar el derecho de acceso a la información.
Subject: General
Geographical_area: Americas, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, South America, South Atlantic, South-Eastern Pacific
Entry into force notes: La presente ley entrará en vigencia ocho meses después de publicada en el Diario Oficial.

Policy: Programa de Acción Nacional contra la Desertificación 2008.
Policy_Content: El objetivo fundamental del Programa de Acción Nacional contra la Desertificación (PAND) es contribuir al logro del desarrollo sostenible de las zonas áridas, semiáridas y subhúmedas secas del territorio nacional y, en particular, la prevención o la reducción de la degradación de las tierras, la rehabilitación de tierras parcialmente degradadas y la recuperación de tierras desertificadas. En el marco del artículo 10 de la Convención de las Naciones Unidas de lucha contra la desertificación en los países afectados por sequía grave o desertificación, en particular en África (CLD), el objetivo del programa de acción consiste en determinar cuáles son los factores que contribuyen a la desertificación y las medidas prácticas necesarias para luchar contra ella y mitigar los efectos de la sequía. El documento se divide en las siguientes partes: 1) Los objetivos de la lucha contra la desertificación; 2) Diagnóstico de la situación en España; 3) Propuestas de acción.

Policy: Regional Decree No. 261-a constituting protected area of regional significance tourism and recreational area “Park “Berendeevka””.
Policy_Content: Protected area of regional significance tourism and recreational area “Park “Berendeevka”” is constituted without expropriation of land plots with a view of conservation of biocenosis, represented by birch-pine communities, as well as regenerating broad-leaved trees in complex with ponds, meadow areas unique for a residential area of urban type, having high potential for recreational use. Protected area of regional significance tourism and recreational area “Park “Berendeevka”” performs the following tasks: (a) conservation of artificial birch-pine communities in conjunction with meadow communities of natural origin; (b) restoration and maintenance of surface water bodies (ponds) in an optimal state; (c) conservation of biodiversity present on the territory; and (d) conservation and development of the territory for recreational use. The following activities shall be prohibited on the territory of protected area of regional significance tourism and recreational area “Park “Berendeevka””: (a) burial of industrial and domestic waste; (b) plowing of land and allotment thereof for collective and individual gardening and horticulture; (c) any type of construction; (d) grazing; and (e) travel and parking of vehicles in places not designated for these purposes.

Policy: Law No. 14.198 establishing the State Policy to Fight and Prevent Desertification.
Policy_Content: This Law establishes the State Policy to Fight and Prevent Desertification. The Policy has the following objectives: support environmental control in areas where the process of desertification is started by encouraging the sustainable use of natural resources, conservation/preservation of the environment and promotion of an agroecological practice adapted to the state environmental conditions; prevent the desertification process in susceptible areas, recover/rehabilitate affected areas, throughout the state territory; create mechanisms for protecting, conserving and recovering flora/fauna and degraded soils, in areas at risk or impacted by desertification; stimulate the policy of natural resources management that ensures the necessary territorial integration for prevention and fight against desertification, articulating the different uses of natural resources and the protection of the environment; stimulate the development of scientific and technological research aimed at the sustainable use of natural resources; promote research and increase knowledge about the desertification process and droughts; promote family farming and food security in areas at risk or affected by desertification; promote social technologies to cope with drought; promote agro-ecological systems, and the diversification of products.
