Policy: Regulation on strategic environmental assessment of plans and programmes.
Policy_Content: This Regulation establishes the method of carrying out the strategic assessment of plans and programmes that have significant effects on the environment. The text includes: the procedure for developing the strategic impact study; the mandatory content of opinions; relevant deadlines; the mandatory content of the report on the manner in which environmental protection requirements have been integrated into a plan or programme; the method of monitoring the environmental status in regard of significant environmental effects of plans or programmes during their implementation  and the method of verifying the implementation of environmental protection measures which have become part of a plan or programme. The Regulation sets out requirements for carrying out the evaluation of the need for strategic environmental assessment to the plans and programmes, as well as the method of case-by-case examinations and the criteria for determining the likely significant environmental effects of the amendments to plans and programmes.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Mediterranean, Southern Europe
Entry into force notes: This Regulation enter into force on 12 June 2008.

Policy: Regulation on remedying of environmental damage.
Policy_Content: This Regulation of the Minister of Environment, which is composed of nine paragraphs, establishes the following types of remedying of environmental damage relating to protected species, natural habitats or waters: basic, supplementary and compensative. Basic remedying should be done first. These  activities should restore initial state of the environment or the state similar to the initial one. Supplementary remedying should assure achievement of the state of natural elements or their functions which would have been achieved if natural elements or their functions environmentally damaged would have been restored in the initial or similar state. Compensative remedying should assure compensation of damages. The Regulation lays down conditions and way of individual types of  remedying action.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries
Entry into force notes: The Regulation enters into force 14 days after publication in the Journal of Laws.

Policy: Energy Corporation of Newfoundland and Labrador Water Rights Act (S.N.L. 2008, c. E-11.02).
Policy_Content: The present Act lays down provisions relating to the issuance of water rights to the Energy Corporation of Newfoundland and Labrador for the Lower Churchill River. At the outset the Act defines the terms “Energy Corporation of Newfoundland and Labrador” and “"Lower Churchill River". Section 3 establishes that subject to the provisions of the Lower Churchill Development Act, any property in and rights to the use and flow of water, previously conferred by a grant, lease, licence or other instrument or under a statute of the province, or vested in, acquired by or accruing to a person by whatever means relating to the Lower Churchill River are extinguished. Section 5 rules that a person is not entitled to compensation or damages from the Crown or a minister, employee or agent of the Crown arising from, resulting from or incidental to the extinguishment of property and rights under section 3. The text consists of 7 sections.

It establishes composition, competences and duties of the above mentioned Governmental institution entitled to: design, implement, coordinate and assess policies in areas related to the promotion and defense of gender equality. SEPI aims at: promoting the support and designing global and sectoral policies strengthening the valorization of the role of women of Timor-Leste in the society; elaborating normative proposals, giving advice and participating in cross-cutting issues in all areas related to promotion of gender equality, establishing mechanisms for revision of laws, policies, budget and governmental programmes; coordinating with different ministries, activities linked with the promotion of equality in order to guarantee an integrated gender approach in all sectors of sustainable development and social rights; promoting good practices related to gender equality, equal participation in socio-economic, politic and familiar sectors in partnership with competent entities to fight any existing discrimination and violence against women; guaranteeing the participation of women in the institutional life and other actions to combat any form of discrimination.

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 426 regarding classification of generating objects based on renewable energy.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree sets forth criteria and modalities for classification of electric power plants and separate energy installations for electric power generation functioning on the basis of renewable energy sources. The purpose of such classification shall be to establish compliance between indices of energy production and energy consumption from renewable energy sources. generating object shall be classified if complying with the following criteria: (a) functioning exclusively on the basis of renewable energy sources or combined use of renewable energy and other energy sources; (b) generating object is operational (put into operation and not put out of operation or is not under maintenance); (c) generating object is connected to electric network organization and equipped with metering device complying with legislative requirements; and (d) generating object ensures fulfilment of target values.

Policy: Decree No. 88/PM on the Implementation of the Land Law.
Policy_Content: This Decree, consisting of 38 articles divided into seven sections, is issued for the purpose of implementing the Land Law relating to the management, protection, use and development of land in an efficient, peaceful, and fair manner as well as ensuring the compliance with the set-targets and the uniformity of practice throughout the country. The National Land Management Authority is charged with coordinating with line sectors and local administrative authorities to create condition for the promotion of land development through: collecting data and formulating plans; conducting a study on policies and regulations; making use of labour, land, material, capital, technique and technology contributed by the state, individuals, or organizations into land development to build infrastructure. The Land Management Authority at local level has the rights and general functions as follows: 1. to carry out land management and administration tasks; 2. to manage land registration, sub-registration and land valuation; 3. to undertake land survey, land allocation, land zoning, land classification and land use planning, give land on lease and concession, set cadastral records, withdrawal land use rights; 4. to issue Land Survey Certificate and Land Title; 5. to collect statistical data and information on land and provide land services; 6. to inspect land use; 7. to gather, and compile statistical data and situation of land use changes within its scope of responsibilities for further reporting to the National Land Management Authority; 8. to implement other rights and functions assigned by the local administrative authorities and in accordance with the technical guideline set out by the National Land Management Authority.

Policy: Código para el Desarrollo Sustentable del Estado de Tamaulipas.
Policy_Content: El presente Código integra en un cuerpo normativo las diversas disposiciones ambientales, con el propósito de afirmar la conexidad de temas, la transversalidad para su atención y el debido cumplimiento de las mismas. En este sentido establece las disposiciones que regulan: I) la protección ambiental; II) la prevención y gestión integral de los residuos; III) las áreas naturales protegidas estatales y municipales; y IV) la flora y fauna silvestres. En virtud del derecho de toda persona a vivir en un ambiente adecuado para su salud, desarrollo y bienestar, el objetivo que el Código se propone es impulsar y promover la conservación, la preservación, la rehabilitación, la remediación, el mejoramiento y el mantenimiento de los ecosistemas; la recuperación y restauración del equilibrio ecológico, la prevención del daño a la salud; el deterioro a la biodiversidad y los elementos que la componen en su conjunto; la gestión y el fomento de la protección al medio ambiente y la planeación ambiental; el aprovechamiento y el uso sustentable de los elementos y recursos naturales y de los bienes ambientales; la internalización y la distribución en forma justa de los beneficios y costos derivados, sustentados en proporcionar certidumbre a los mercados en el marco de las políticas establecidas para el desarrollo sustentable en el Estado.

Policy: Protection of the Environment Operations (Underground Petroleum Storage Systems) Regulation 2008

Les droits réels grevant les constructions, ouvrages et équipements fixes édifiés par les concessionnaires pour l'exercice de leurs activités durant la période des concessions sont inscrits au registre. Ils y sont aussi inscrits, les droits des créanciers hypothécaires grevant ces constructions, ouvrages et équipements fixes. Le présent décret fixe les modalités de la tenue du registre.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Africa, Mediterranean, NEAR EAST AND NORTH AFRICA, Northern Africa

Policy: Décret n°2008-2034  fixant les modalités de la tenue du registre des droits réels  grevant les ouvrages d'assainissement, constructions et équipements fixes y afférents.

Ils y sont aussi inscrits, les droits des créanciers hypothécaires grevant ces constructions, ouvrages et équipements fixes.
Subject: Land & soil, Water

Policy: Regional Law No. 278-47 “On delimitation of plenary powers between state bodies in the sphere of land relations”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law delimits plenary powers between state bodies in the sphere of regulation of land relations. Legislative Assembly shall carry out the following plenary powers: (a) adoption of legislative acts regulating land relations; (b) establishment of cases of land expropriation; and (c) establishment of minimum and maximum land areas allotted to citizens for housing construction. Regional Government shall carry out the following plenary powers: (a) land-use planning; (b) regional land monitoring; (c) land inventory; (d) mapping; (e) establishment of deadline for payment of land lease fees; and (f) modalities of land expropriation.

Policy: Ley de desarrollo económico sustentable.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley establece los lineamientos generales de política pública a los que se sujetará la promoción del desarrollo económico sustentable en el Estado de Morelos. Cabe detacar el enfoque adoptado con respecto a la protección del medio ambiente y a la explotación sustentable de los recursos del Estado. Se enuncia entre los objetivos generales de la Ley la promoción de un desarrollo económico compatible con la preservación de los recursos naturales y el medio ambiente. En este marco, el artículo 19 dispone que tendrán preferencia en la obtención de los beneficios de los programas y acciones de fomento económico, las personas físicas y morales que cumplan con alguna de las siguientes condiciones: a) que el proyecto prevea el uso racional de los recursos naturales con el fin de proteger el medio ambiente; b) que el proyecto prevea el uso racional de los recursos hídricos y la aplicación de sistemas de tratamiento y reciclado del agua; c) que el proyecto prevea el uso y fomento de fuentes de energía renovable y limpia.
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy: Decree No. 734 of the Council of Ministers validating Regulation on formation and keeping database on the state of environment, composition of general ecological information subject to compulsory dissemination, holders of such information bound to disseminate it and periodicity of dissemination.
Policy_Content: This Decree establishes that State fund of data on the state of environment shall be set up containing ecological information submitted by the authorized state institutions in the sphere of natural resources, environmental protection, forestry, agriculture and food, animal and plant inspections and local executive bodies. The objective of the Fund shall be ecological data collection, processing, reporting and ensuring access to ecological information to state bodies, public organizations, legal and natural persons. The following ecological information shall be subject to compulsory inclusion in the Fund: (a) monitoring; (b) environmental measurements; (c) environmental registration; (d) management of natural resources; (e) issuance of environmental permits; (f) environmental assessment; (g) EIA; (h) environmental audit; (i) ecological certification; and (j) environmental rate setting. Holders of ecological information are listed in the Annex 1. Holders of ecological information shall grant access to it free of charge updating annually databases by 1 October.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA
Entry into force notes: This Decree enters into force on 1 July 2008.

Policy: Arrêté du 23 mai 2008 autorisant des opérations de destruction de loups (Canis lupus) pour la période 2008-2009.
Policy_Content: En application du 4° de l'article L. 411-2 du code de l'environnement et selon les modalités fixées par le présent arrêté, il peut être procédé, à titre dérogatoire, à des opérations de destruction de spécimens de l'espèce loup (Canis lupus) aux fins de prévenir des dommages importants aux élevages et dans la mesure où il n'existe pas d'autre solution satisfaisante. Les opérations de destruction ne peuvent intervenir que si les mesures de protection des troupeaux et le recours à l'effarouchement ne constituent pas une solution satisfaisante pour prévenir ces dommages. Ces destructions ne doivent pas nuire au maintien, dans un état de conservation favorable, de la population de loups dans leur aire de répartition naturelle. A cet effet, le nombre maximum de spécimens de loups (mâles ou femelles) dont la destruction est autorisée en application du présent arrêté est fixé à 6. Le respect de ces conditions est assuré selon les modalités fixées par le protocole technique d'intervention annexé au présent arrêté.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Livestock, Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Financial agricultural measures,Animal production,Dangerous animal/harmful animal

Policy: Order No. 325 of the Ministry of Agriculture validating the Instruction on state registration of the forest fund.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes that all the forest plots of 0,05 ha and over shall be subject to mandatory state registration. State registration shall be (a) annual for each calendar year period; and (b) periodical – once in five years. The following preparatory work shall be carried out for state forest registration: (a) completeness and correctness of data related to change of forested area in the forest fund since the previous registration; (b) forest inventory data for the previous years; and (c) specification of subdivision of forests by categories. Explanatory note shall be attached to state registration of the forest fund form. Public forest owners shall submit to the registration authority information related to floodplain forests and riparian woodland and classification by categories thereof.

Policy: Ley Nº 3/2008 - Ley de ordenación de la minería de Galicia.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley de ordenación de la minería de Galicia, tiene por objeto el desarrollo del régimen jurídico de las actividades mineras en Galicia en condiciones de sostenibilidad y seguridad promoviendo un aprovechamiento racional compatible con la protección del medio ambiente. La presente Ley es de aplicación a las siguientes actividades: 1) a la exploración, investigación, explotación y aprovechamiento de los recursos minerales y demás recursos geológicos situados en Galicia; 2) al aprovechamiento de recursos geotérmicos y de formaciones geológicas superficiales o subterráneas; 3) a la preparación para la entrega a los mercados de los minerales y recursos extraídos; 4) a la gestión de los residuos producidos en las actividades extractivas; 5) a la recuperación ambiental de los terrenos afectados por labores mineras, así como a las condiciones y requisitos del abandono de la actividad minera; 6) a la actividad administrativa de apoyo para la mejora e innovación en las actividades mineras, a fin de disminuir el impacto sobre los recursos naturales y la valorización integral de los recursos producidos en la búsqueda del cierre del ciclo productivo en Galicia.

Policy: Local Government Act 2008.
Policy_Content: This Act, consisting of 280 sections divided into 20 Chapters and completed by three Schedules, divides the State into municipal areas and electoral districts. Under the system of local government established by this Act: a) the Territory is divided into local government areas having regard to: i) geography and natural configuration; and ii) the nature and density of population; and iii) the viability, and appropriateness, of each area as a separate unit of local government administration; and b) a council (the local government council) is constituted for each area to be responsible for the government and management of the area at the local level. Local government areas are classified as municipalities, regions or shires according to their geographical size, the density of their population and their degree of urbanisation. Schedules list Code of conduct – core provisions and Repealed Acts.

Policy: Loi relative à l’évaluation des incidences de certains plans et programmes sur l’environnement.
Policy_Content: La présente loi porte la réglementation relative à l’évaluation des incidences de certains plans et programmes sur l’environnement. L’article 8 établit que lorsque la mise en oeuvre d’un projet de plan ou de programme relevant du champ d’application de la présente loi est susceptible d’avoir des incidences notables sur l’environnement dans un autre Etat membre, ou lorsqu’un autre Etat membre susceptible d’être touché de manière notable en exprime la demande, une copie du projet de plan ou de programme ainsi qu’une copie du rapport sur les incidences environnementales sont transmises à l’autre Etat membre avant que ledit plan ou programme ne soit adopté ou soumis à la procédure législative ou réglementaire. Le texte comprend 14 articles comme suit: Définitions (1); Evaluation environnementale (2); Critères déterminant les incidences sur l’environnement (3); Obligations générales (4); Rapport sur les incidences environnementales: principe et contenu (5); Rapport sur les incidences environnementales: modalités (6); Consultation (7); Consultations transfrontières (8); Eléments à prendre en considération dans le cadre de la prise de décision (9); Information sur la décision (10); Suivi (11); Voies de recours (12); Comité interministériel (13); Entrée en vigueur et dispositions transitoires (14).

Policy: Regional Law No. 22-ZRT “On forest management”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates forest management on regional territory. It establishes that forest parcels shall be reserved for timber extraction by citizens for individual personal needs. Citizens shall carry out timber extraction for individual personal needs in accordance with purchase and sale contracts of forest species. Regional executive bodies shall fix rates of fees for timber extraction by citizens for individual personal needs. This Regional Law establishes rates of timber extraction by citizens for residential housing construction and heating. Citizens shall be granted the right of free access to forests for collection and harvesting of non-timber forest resources, including medicinal plants.

Policy: Arrêté du 21 mai 2008 modifiant l'arrêté du 23 décembre 1999 relatif aux caractéristiques du gazole et du gazole grand froid.
Policy_Content: Les esters méthyliques d'acides gras, conformes à la norme EN 14214, incorporés dans le gazole et dans le gazole grand froid doivent être additivés dès leur production et avant stockage d'un produit antioxydant. En conséquence, l'annexe I de l'arrêté du 23 décembre 1999 susvisé est remplacée par l'annexe au présent arrêté.

Policy: Directive 2008/50/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council on ambient air quality and cleaner air for Europe.
Policy_Content: This Directive defines objectives for ambient air quality designed to avoid, prevent or reduce harmful effects on human health and the environment as a whole. To this end, it sets out measures for the assessment of ambient air quality in Member States as well as for obtaining information on ambient air quality in order to help combat air pollution and nuisance. The Directive aims at increasing cooperation between the Member States in reducing air pollution.

Policy: Clean Energy Act 2008.
Policy_Content: The main object of this Act is to improve the efficiency and management of the use of energy, and the conservation of energy, in relation to particular businesses and other activities. The regulator is the chief executive and he may give an energy provider a written notice requiring the provider to give the regulator the name and address of, and the amount of energy used by, any customer the energy provider has supplied with 10 terajoules or more of energy, but less than 500 terajoules of energy, at the site of the customer, in the 1 year period stated in the notice. The regulator must keep a register, the Smart Energy Savings Register and each registered participating business must carry out an energy audit no later than 12 months after the end of each verification year for the participating business and give the regulator an energy savings plan.
Subject: Energy

Policy: Décret n° 2008-517 du 20 mai 2008 fixant les modalités d’organisation et de fonctionnement des Agences régionales de Développement.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret crée l’Agence régionale de Développement ayant pour mission générale l’appui à la coordination et à l’harmonisation des interventions et initiatives des collectivités locales en matière de développement local.  De façon spécifique, elle est chargée de: l’appui et la facilitation à la planification du développement local ; l’appui à la mise en cohérence des interventions entre collectivités locales d’une même région d’une part et avec les politiques et plans nationaux d’autre part ; le suivi évaluation des programmes et plans d’actions de développement local ; l’élaboration, l’appui à l’exécution et le suivi des contrats de mise à disposition des services extérieurs de l’Etat ; l’élaboration et le suivi des contrats plans. Les organes de l’Agence régionale de Développement sont : le Conseil d’Administration ; le Président du Conseil d’Administration ; et le Directeur de l’Agence.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Least Developed Countries, North Atlantic, Sahel, Western Africa

Policy: Décret n° 2008-514 du 20 mai 2008 portant création et fixant les règles d’organisation et de fonctionnement de l’Agence nationale du cadre de vie et de la qualité de la consommation.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret crée l’Agence nationale du cadre de vie et de la qualité de la consommation (ANCVQC).  En concertation avec les services du Ministère de l’urbanisme, de l’habitat, de l’hydraulique urbaine, de l’hygiène publique et de l’assainissement et du ministre du commerce, l’agence a pour mission de : lutter contre les encombrements divers de la voirie publique (marchands ambulants non autorisés, véhicules abandonnés...); coordonner une politique efficace d’élimination des déchets (plastiques, papiers, canettes...) ; améliorer l’esthétique du cadre de vie (aspects extérieurs des bâtiments et des étals autorisés, respects des règles de retraits et de servitudes d’accès,...) lutter contre les nuisances sonores et olfactives ; de surveiller la qualité des produits offerts à la consommation. L’agence comprend deux organes : le conseil de surveillance, et la direction générale.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Least Developed Countries, North Atlantic, Sahel, Western Africa

Policy: Law No. 3661 on measures for the reduction of energy consumption of buildings and other provisions related thereto.
Policy_Content: With the provisions of the present law, the Greek legislative framework is harmonized with Directive No. 2002/91/EC of the European Parliament and Council on the energy performance of newly build and existing buildings. With a Joint Decree issued by the Ministers of Economy and Finance, Growth and Environment, Land planning and Public Works, which shall be issued obligatorily within six (6) months after the coming into force of the present law, a Regulation of Energy Performance of Buildings shall be established.  The Regulation shall determine the methodology of calculation of the energy performance of buildings, the minimum requirements for their energy performance, the type and the content of a study for the energy performance of buildings, the competent authorities responsible for issuing the study, the process and frequency of energy performance related inspections to buildings, boilers and installations of heating and systems of air conditioning, the type and the content of the Energy Performance Certificate as prescribed in article 6.

Policy: Presidential Decree No. 815 “On measures to combat corruption.”
Policy_Content: The President, with a view of creating the system to combat corruption in the Russian Federation, to establish the Council for Countering Corruption under the President of the Russian Federation. The Chairman of the Council shall be the President of the Russian Federation. The main tasks of the Council shall be as follows: (a) preparation of proposals to the President of the Russian Federation concerning the development and implementation of state policy in the field of combating corruption; (b) coordinating the activities of the federal executive authorities, the executive authorities of the constituent entities (regions) of the Russian Federation and local municipal authorities related to the implementation of government policy on combating corruption; and (c) control over the implementation of measures provided for by the National Anti-Corruption Plan to combat corruption.

Policy: Radiation Protection, Safety and Nuclear Security Law No.43 of 2007.
Policy_Content: This Law consisting of 28 articles aims at providing for (i) safe use of nuclear energy; (ii) safety and security of radiation sources; and (iii) radiation protection, including management and treatment of radioactive waste and spent fuel, transport of radioactive materials, and extracting, mining and processing of the nuclear materials. Article 3 establishes the Radiation and Nuclear Regulatory Commission, linked to the Prime Minister, with the following main tasks (i) regulate and control the use of nuclear energy and ionizing radiation; (ii) protect the environment, human health and property from the hazards of contamination and exposure to ionizing radiation; and (iii) ensure the fulfilment of requirements of public safety, radiation protection, and nuclear safety and security. Main powers of the Commission shall be (i) granting licenses and permits for radiation institutions, nuclear facilities, and workers in the radiation and nuclear fields and check up of the commitment of the licensees; (ii) control on the implementation of this Law also conducting inspections; (iii) contact institutions and commissions concerned with regulating and control of nuclear energy and related issues in the Arab and foreign countries to benefit from the expertise, scientific research, and assistance; and (iv) implement comprehensive safeguards, and create a system to account for and control of all nuclear materials subject to these safeguards. The Commission shall charge fees for licenses and permits it issues and for their renewal (art.11). Article 14 and 17 list the prohibited activities, also related to foodstaff and waste management and disposal. Article 21deals with inspections in places suspected of containing unlicensed sources, materials, equipment or radiation devices, or that any activites are practiced in violation to the terms of this Law. The reports will be submited to the Director General of the Commission.

Policy: Regional Law No. 25-OZ “On regulation of land relations”.
Policy_Content: The priorities of regional land policy shall be: (a) state regulation for ensuring conservation of valuable land, agricultural land and land of protected areas; (b) realization of the land right of citizens; (c) application of land tenure ensuring ecosystem preservation; (d) conservation of agricultural land as the basis of agricultural production; and (e) conservation of traditional forms of Cossack land tenure (art. 1). This Regional Law establishes minimum and maximum dimensions of the allotment of public land, including agricultural land, in ownership to citizens for different uses, including agricultural production and subsidiary farming (arts. 8-13).  This Regional law envisages cases of expropriation of land (arts. 20-21) and purchase and sale of plots of land (arts. 22-24). Minimum period of lease of agricultural land for agricultural purposes shall be 11 months (art. 29). Public land servitude shall be applicable to land plots that have passed land registration and have been inserted in public land cadastre (art. 37).

Policy: Estrategia Regional Agroambiental y de Salud de Centroamérica 2009-2024.
Policy_Content: La Estrategia Regional Agroambiental y de Salud de Centroamérica  es un instrumento estratégico adoptado en el marco del Sistema de la Integración Centroamericana (SICA). Objetivo general del documento es promover un mecanismo intersectorial para la gestión agroambiental, con énfasis en el manejo sostenible de tierras, biodiversidad, variabilidad y cambio climático, negocios agro-ambientales, espacios y estilos de vida saludables, de manera que contribuya al desarrollo humano sostenible. La Estrategia es pues una iniciativa innovadora del sistema de la integración regional centroamericana, que parte de un enfoque de coordinación y armonización. El instrumento procura articular y promover el trabajo intersectorial con acciones concertadas bajo una visión unificada, en un marco de sostenibilidad, adaptación al cambio climático, equidad y participación ciudadana y así contribuir a la reducción de la pobreza y a garantizar la seguridad alimentaria en un esfuerzo conjunto de los actores público y privado de agricultura, ambiente y salud. Las acciones propuestas se sustentan en los principios establecidos en el Protocolo de Tegucigalpa a la Carta de la Organización de Estados Centroamericanos (ODECA) y en el Protocolo de Guatemala al Tratado General de Integración Económica, resaltándose y complementándose, entre otros, los principios de sostenibilidad, equidad de género y participación ciudadana.

Policy: Yemen National Implementation Plan for POPs.
Policy_Content: This National Imlementation Plan for POPs is a nationwide sectoral document aiming at (i) developing a sustainable policy; (ii) ensuring the protection of human health and the environment from the impact of POPs by developing and regularly improving the most effective and optimal POPs management system. Guiding principles of the policy are (i) obtain a thorough image of the risk caused by POPs to the population and environment by identifying the location of the sites, their scale and their urgency; (ii) protect human health and the environment from the harmful impact of POPs by reducing POPs emissions and leakages, as well as gradually ceasing the use of POPs or POP-containing equipment; (iii) promote the cooperation between individuals and entities  directly or indirectly involved in POPs created problems; and (iv) attract donations to promote a decrease or elimination of the risk caused by POPs to human health or the environment.

Policy: Décret n° 2008-499 du 9 mai 2008 portant création et fixant les règles d’organisation et de fonctionnement de l’Agence nationale de la Météorologie du Sénégal.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret crée l’Agence nationale de la Météorologie du Sénégal (ANAMS) ayant pour missions de promouvoir et de mettre en œuvre la politique gouvernementale en matière de météorologie. Elle est chargée notamment de: coordonner et de contrôler toutes les activités météorologiques au Sénégal; gérer les engagements de l’Etat en matière de météorologie; négocier les accords bilatéraux et multilatéraux dans le cadre des habilitations et mandats conférés par l’Etat; exploiter et d’assurer l’inspection régulière ainsi que la maintenance de l’ensemble des stations météorologiques y compris les postes pluviométriques répartis sur le territoire national; élaborer une réglementation et de veiller à son application, conformément aux normes de l’Organisation Météorologique Mondiale (OMM); animer et de coordonner l’ensemble des opérations de recherche appliquée et de recherche fondamentale en matière de météorologie en mettant en place une base de données météorologiques et climatologiques; conduire les activités portant sur la modification artificielle du temps; satisfaire les besoins en assistance météorologique nécessaires à la sécurité aéronautique et maritime; contribuer à la sécurité et au développement des secteurs socio-économiques. L’Agence est membre de droit des commissions, comités, assemblées et conseils dont l’objet se rapporte à ses missions. L’Agence y est représentée par son Directeur général ou son représentant. L’Agence comprend deux organes: le Conseil d’Orientation; et le Directeur général.

Policy: Regional Law No. 31-OZ “On turnover of agricultural land”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates relations concerning ownership and tenancy of land, and determines terms and conditions for allocation of plots of agricultural land pertaining to state and municipal property, and also the modalities of expropriation of thereof in regional and municipal ownership. Regional administration shall have preferential terms for purchase of agricultural land in case of sale thereof by natural and legal persons at market price. Minimum dimensions of agricultural land plots authorized for transactions shall be no less than minimum dimensions of agricultural land area allotted  out of stock of public land for farming to natural and legal persons in accordance with the regional legislation and maximum agricultural land plot area that can be owned by a single household or by a single legal person shall be twenty percent of total available agricultural land area at the moment of allotment or purchase of the aforesaid agricultural land plot.

Policy: Regional Law No. 88-OZ “On protected areas”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law classifies protected areas as of regional and local significance and into the following categories: (a) natural parks; (b) state nature reserves; (c) nature monuments; (d) dendrological parks and botanical gardens; (e) healthcare areas and spas; and (f) historical landscapes. Protected areas shall be taken into consideration in the process of land-use planning. Protected areas shall be delimited on-site by informative marks. Complex ecological inspection of protected areas shall be carried out regularly by the authorized state regional environmental institution. In accordance with the aforesaid inspection and environmental audit regional administration shall make decision related to the institution of protected areas.

Policy: Youth Law (2008)
Policy_Content: This Law is to improve the life quality of young people - persons from 13 to 25 years of age - by promoting their initiatives, participation in decision-making and social life, as well as by supporting youth work. The Law determines the persons involved in the implementation of the youth policy and the competence thereof in the field of this policy, youth participation in the development and implementation of the youth policy, as well as the basic principles for granting of financing to youth initiatives, for participation in decision-making and social life and for youth work. Within the meaning of this Law youth work is a set of planned youth-oriented practical measures, which ensure the improvement of their life quality. The Law further provides that the State shall promote the commercial activity and employment of young people, particularly training of young people in matters related to the commencement of commercial activity; support to the commencement of commercial activity of young people; and support to projects for the promotion of employment of young people, particularly young people subject to the risk of social exclusion.

Policy: Development Planning System Law (2008)
Policy_Content: The Law lays down rules for development planning in Latvia. Its purpose is to promote sustainable and stable development of the State, as well as the improvement of the quality of life of inhabitants, by determining the development planning system. The Law applies to the development planning in the Saeima, the Cabinet, State institutions of direct administration, planning regions and State administrative institutions which are not subordinated to the Cabinet. According to the Law, the development planning is the development of principles, objectives and actions necessary for the achievement thereof in order to implement politically specified priorities and to ensure the development of the society and territory. In addition, the development planning system must cover policy planning and territorial development planning and ensure the coherence and mutual co-ordination of the decisions taken by State and local government institutions.

Policy: Regional Law No. 4-RZ “On exceptional cases of timber extraction in accordance with purchase and sale contract of forest species”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes the following exceptional cases of timber extraction in accordance with purchase and sale contract of forest species: (a) for proper needs by public institutions, agricultural organizations and peasant farms registered on the regional territory in accordance with established rates of timber extraction; (b) for repairs of production sites, residential housing facilities and dependency and farm buildings destroyed by fires and other natural disasters; (c) urgent timber extraction as a result of forest fires, windfall and damage of stand by pests and diseases causing loss of market qualities of timber; and (d) felling of falling trees.

Policy: Regional Law No. 6-RZ “On use of forests for hunting management”.
Policy_Content: This regional Law establishes rules for the use of forest plots within forest fund (public forest) for hunting management. It establishes rights and duties of lessees and lessors originating from the use of forest plots for hunting management. Natural and legal persons that are lessees of forest plots destined for hunting management shall have the right: (a) to carry out biotechnical arrangements; (b) to procure forest resources to be used as forage for wild fauna species; and (c) to have access to information related to forest plot conceded on lease. Natural and legal persons that are lessees of forest plots destined for hunting management shall have the duty: (a) observe the provisions of forest plot lease contract; (b) to prevent environmental damages; (c) to comply with forest fire safety arrangements; (d) observe sanitary rules in forests; (e) observe legislative provisions and prevent offences.
Subject: Forestry, Wild species & ecosystems

Policy: Regional Law No. 1188-ZRK “On delimitation of plenary powers of state bodies in the sphere of forest relations”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes delimitation of plenary powers of regional administration between the regional government authorities. Regional Legislative Assembly shall have the following competence: (a) establishment of the modalities and rates of timber extraction by citizens for individual personal needs; (b) establishment of the modalities of procurement and collection of edible non-timber forest resources and medicinal plant for individual personal needs; (c) establishment rates of procurement of non-timber forest products for individual personal needs; (d) establishment of the rules of forest management for hunting purposes; and (e) establishment of exceptional cases of timber extraction in accordance with purchase and sale contracts of forest species.  Regional Government shall have the following plenary powers: (a) ownership and management of public forest parcels; (b) forest fees and charges; (c) timber extraction tariffs; and (d) modalities of conclusion of purchase and sale contracts of forest species. Authorized state forest institution shall have the following plenary powers: (a) concession of forest parcels; (b) elaboration of forest management plans; (c) issuance of forest management authorization; (d) forest fire protection, afforestation and reforestation in forest fund; and (e) forest inventory and forest supervision.

Policy: Goa (Regulation of Land Development and Building Construction) Act, 2008 (Goa Act No. 6 of 2008).
Policy_Content: This Act provides for the regulation and control on building construction and land development in the State of Goa. It specifies the following provisions: all applications for land development permission or construction licenses for building submitted, before the date of commencement of regulations framed under section 7, shall be considered as per the law applicable before the commencement of this Act. In respect of areas, which are not declared as planning areas under section 18 of the Goa Town and Country Planning Act, 1974 (Act 21 of 1975), no objection certificate shall be necessary to be obtained from the Town and Country Planning Department from planning point of view. Any application for land development or construction of building received by the Panchayat/Municipal Council/Municipal Corporation shall be forwarded by the concerned authority to the respective district level/taluka level office of the Town and Country Planning Department for obtaining no objection certificate from planning point of view. The Town and Country Planning Department shall consider the applications for issuing a certificate for the proposed land development and/or construction of building.

Policy: Decreto Nº 22-2008: Ley contra el femicidio y otras formas de violencia contra la mujer.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley reconoce que las mujeres guatemaltecas tienen derecho al goce, ejercicio y protección de todos los derechos humanos y las libertades consagradas en la Constitución Política de la República e instrumentos internacionales en materia de derechos humanos. En este contexto se garantiza la vida, la libertad, la integridad, la dignidad, la protección y la igualdad de todas las mujeres ante la ley, particularmente cuando por condición de género, en las relaciones de poder o confianza, en el ámbito público o privado quien agrede, cometa en contra de ellas prácticas discriminatorias, de violencia física, psicológica, económica o de menosprecio a sus derechos. En cuanto a la protección contra toda violencia económica, ésta se define como todas aquellas acciones u omisiones que repercutan en el uso, goce, disponibilidad o accesibilidad de una mujer a los bienes materiales que le pertenecen por derecho, por vínculo matrimonial o unión de hecho, por capacidad o por herencia, causándole deterioro, daño, transformación, sustracción, destrucción, retención o pérdida de objetos o bienes materiales propios o del grupo familiar, así como la retención de instrumentos de trabajo, documentos personales, bienes, valores, derechos o recursos económicos (art. 3º).

Policy: Regulation establishing criteria of environmental damage assessment.
Policy_Content: This Regulation of the Minister of Environment, which is composed of six paragraphs, establishes criteria of assessment if there was an environmental damage relating to protected species or natural habitats, waters or land. If in the given case, the change of the state has a measurable, negative impact to human health, it is assumed that there was an environmental damage. The criteria of environmental damage assessment is the change causing one or more of the following results: (1) destruction or damage of natural habitats; (2) deterioration of the state of population of protected species on the given area; (3) reduction of the surface of natural habitats; (4) deterioration of protection possibilities of protected species.
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy: Order No. 109 of the Ministry of Natural Resources and Ecology validating the Regulation on state nature reserve of federal significance “National park “Zov tigra (Tiger call)”.
Policy_Content: The Ministry establishes that state nature reserve of federal significance “National park “Zov tigra (Tiger call)” shall have the status of state environmental protection, scientific research and educational institution, which includes ecosystems, natural complexes and areas of historical and cultural heritage, of recreational, aesthetic and tourist value, of the Far East of the Russian Federation, with the scope of environmental protection, educational, scientific and cultural purposes, and for regulated tourism. It is located on the territory of Primorie area. Reserve shall have the following purposes: (a) conservation and protection of unique natural ecosystems; (b) conservation of cultural heritage; (c) ecological monitoring; (d) ecological education; (e) scientific research; and (f) regulated tourism. The following activities shall be prohibited on the territory of reserve: (a) exploration and mining; (b) soil disturbance; (c) horticulture and gardening; (d) construction of roads and pipelines; (e) timber extraction and procurement of non-timber forest products; and (f) removal of the objects of cultural heritage.

Policy: Order No. D1-230 validating Environmental Protection Requirements for treatment of contaminated sites polluted with chemical substances.
Policy_Content: The scope of Environmental Protection Requirements for treatment of contaminated sites polluted with chemical substances shall be: (a) protection of public health; (b) protection of soil, subsoil and groundwater from potential pollution including involvement of pesticides; and (c) reduction of adverse effects on soil, subsoil, deeper soil layers and groundwater, the state of the ecosystems associated with these environmental components. The Requirements shall include surveys of chemically contaminated sites, procedures, limit values for soil, ground and groundwater contamination, the procedure and basic requirements for setting revised limit values for soil contamination and management of chemically contaminated sites. The risk of pollution is assessed with the consideration of analytical calculations performed in accordance with the Regulation on Ecogeological Research, or modeling using pollution risk assessment software. The need for the management of a chemically contaminated area shall be determined after the performance of a detailed investigation of the contaminated site, taking into account the results of the investigations and registration thereof for the current and future uses in accordance with Description of Environmental Rehabilitation Measures. Annex 1 contains the list of activities that may cause potential soil, ground and groundwater pollution. Annex 2 groups territories sensitive to chemical contamination. Annex 3 establishes limit values for content of chemical substances in soil and groundwater. Annex 4 establishes revised limit values of chemical substances in soil and ground.
Subject: Environment gen., Land & soil
Keyword: Pollution control,Soil conservation/soil improvement,Soil pollution/quality,Soil rehabilitation,Ecosystem preservation,Hazardous substances,Public health,Registration

Policy: Palestinian Reform and Development Plan (PRDP) 2008 - 2010.

The guiding policy framework for the PRDP is the Palestinian national Policy Agenda (PNPA) containing the national goals and supporting objectives which set out the priorities for the PNA over the medium term. Policy_Content: This Decree establishes that the Ministry of Agriculture is the central executive body of state power elaborating and implementing unified state policy in the field of agriculture. The Ministry shall perform the following functions: (a) development and implementation of the unified state policy in the sphere of agriculture, including crop production, livestock and other branches of agricultural production; (b) development of programs and production forecasts to ensure effective use of the country's agricultural potential; (c) organization of monitoring of production and profitability of agricultural production, determination of development trends; (d) control over import, export, production and use of agricultural commodities; and (e) support of producers of agricultural commodities. The Ministry shall have the following powers: (a) formulation of short-, medium- and long-term agricultural development programs and plans; (b) monitoring of the current state of production and unit costs of agricultural and processing enterprises of agricultural commodities, profits and losses; (c) development of measures to promote food security and agricultural production; (d) attraction of foreign and domestic investments in agriculture; and (e) periodic preparation and publication of national reports and reports on the state of agriculture.

Policy: Law No. 90-XVI “On preventing and combating corruption.”
Policy_Content: This Law establishes measures to prevent and combat corruption, ensuring the protection of the rights and freedoms of a person, public interests, national security, as well as elimination of the consequences of acts of corruption. Corruption shall be intended a wrongful act affecting the normal performance of official duties and consisting in the use by the subject of an act of corruption or the fact of the corrupt behavior of their official position for the request, accepting or agreeing to accept, directly or indirectly, for oneself or another person, material goods or unrequited benefits, or in an illegal promise, offering or granting to the subjects of acts of corruption material goods or unrequited benefits. Legal relations in the field of preventing and combating corruption are governed by this Law, other legislative acts, and international treaties to which the Republic of Moldova is a party. Measures to prevent and combat corruption may be regulated also by other normative acts adopted in accordance with this Law. The provisions of this Law shall be applicable to the following categories: (a) civil servants, appointees of responsible state positions, employees of the cabinet of appointees of responsible state positions, employees of autonomous or regulatory public authorities, electoral competitors, proxies of electoral competitors and others, envisaged by acting legislation; (b) persons managing commercial, public or other  non-governmental organizations; and (c) foreign public persons and international employees. Prevention of corruption is guaranteed by policies and practices in relevant area, representing a set of legislative, institutional, economic, social and moral measures implemented by regulating: (a) organizing the activities of public authorities; (b) behavior of civil servants, appointees of responsible  government positions, and other persons providing public services; (c) organization of anti-corruption expertise of draft legislative acts and drafts of regulatory acts of the Government, public discussion of the developed projects and assessment of institutional risks of corruption; (d) the procedure for the formation and management of public finances; (e) civil society participation and access to information in the process of decision-making; (f) access to information on anti-corruption measures and results of their applications; (g) the private sector of the national economy; (h) prevention of legalization of illegally obtained income; (i) political activity and electoral process; (j) other measures necessary to achieve the objectives of this Law. Public authorities adopt their own programs in their areas of relevant activities for the implementation of the National Strategy for the Prevention of Corruption and Combating It. The National Anti-Corruption Center is a specialized body empowered to prevent corruption and combat acts of corruption or with facts of corrupt behavior.
Subject: General

Policy: Law No. 90 “On preventing and combating corruption.”
Policy_Content: This Law establishes measures to prevent and combat corruption, ensuring the protection of human rights and freedoms, public interests, national security, as well as the elimination of the consequences of acts of corruption. Corruption shall be intended an illegal act that affects the normal performance of official duties and consists in the use by the subject of the act of corruption or the fact of corrupt conduct, of his or her official position in order to solicit acceptance or consent to accept, directly or indirectly, for himself or herself or for another person, material benefits or an unjustifiable advantage or to promise offering or providing the subjects of acts of corruption with pecuniary advantages or of material benefits or non-pecuniary benefits. Corruption prevention is guaranteed by the policies and practices of the relevant field, which constitute a set of legislative, institutional, economic, social and moral measures implemented through: (a) organization of the activities of public authorities; (b) conduct of civil servants, persons exercising responsible public services and other persons providing public services; (c) organizing anti-corruption expertise of draft legislative acts and draft government regulations, public discussion of drafts and assessment of institutional risks of corruption; (d) the manner of formation and management of public finances; (e) the participation of civil society and access to information in decision-making; (f) the procedures and mechanisms for decision-making; (e) participation of civil society and access to information in the decision-making  process; (f) access to information on measures to prevent corruption and the results of their application; (g) involvement of private sector of the national economy; (h) prevention of money-laundering; (i) political activity and the electoral process; and (j) other measures necessary to achieve the purposes of this Law. This Law consists of VII Chapters divided into 26 Articles. Chapter I lays down general provisions. Chapter II establishes measure for the prevention of corruption. Chapter III regards bodies exercising powers for prevention and combating corruption. Chapter IV establishes liability for acts of corruption. Chapter V regards elimination of the consequences of acts of corruption. Chapter VI regards international cooperation. Chapter VII lays down final provisions.

Policy: Agriculture Act.
Policy_Content: This Act sets out the objectives of agricultural policy and regulates provisions governing planning agricultural and rural development, agricultural policy measures, the safety of food of plant origin in primary production, food quality at all stages of production, processing and transport, and consumer protection. This Act provides also details on the labeling of agricultural products and foodstuffs, the marketing of agricultural products and foodstuffs, conservation of biodiversity in agriculture, supplementary activities on farms, databases and information on agriculture, and procedures and bodies involved in the implementation of this Act. The objectives of agricultural policy in Slovenia are: (a) stable production of safe, high quality and cheaper food as well as ensuring food security; (b) preservation of the settlement and cultivation of the countryside and landscape; (c) long-term preservation of fertility of agricultural land; (d) protection of agricultural land from pollution and irrational use and improvement of resources for sustainable food production; (e) continuous increasing of competitiveness of agriculture; (f) adequate income level; (g) implementation of the principles of environmental protection and nature conservation and preservation of genetic resources. This Act is composed of 35 articles divided into the following Sections: General provisions (Sec. 1); Feed (Sec. 2); Plants (Sec. 3); Conformity assessment (Sec. 4); Official control (Sec. 5); Finance program (Sec. 6); Liabilities (Sec. 7); Penalty provisions (Sec. 8); Transitional and final provisions (Sec. 9).

Policy: National Forest Policy of Montenegro.
Policy_Content: The National Forest Policy of Montenegro is a national sectoral policy whose main objectives are: a) to ensure and improve long-term resistance and productivity of forests and other ecosystems; b) to ensure the maintenance of plant and animal species; c) to ensure sustainable forest administration and sustainable implementation of social, economic and environmental forest functions; d) to ensure the contribution of forests to social and economic development of rural areas; e) to ensure long-term development and competitiveness of wood industry. The document  is based upon the following principles: ecoogical and socio-economic sustainability; ecosystem approach to forest management; synergy among forest functions; precautionary principle; participation and cooperation of all stakeholders; monitoring and evaluation of work.

Policy: Regional Law No.296-4-ZKO “On rules of forest management for hunting purposes”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates the issues of forest management for hunting purposes. Hunting management shall be considered entrepreneurial activity. Management of forest parcels for hunting purposes shall be performed in accordance with lease contracts in compliance with forest management projects. Forest parcels allocated in lease for hunting management can be used for the following purposes: (a) procurement of forest resources with a view of conservation of biological diversity and ensuring stable and sustainable existence and reproduction of wild fauna species; (b) captive keeping and breeding of wild fauna species; and (c) regulation of the number of wild fauna species subject to hunting. Artisanal and sport hunting shall be performed by citizens without allotment of forest parcels in accordance with acting legislation.

Policy_Content: This Decree of the Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development establishes the requirements for the maintenance of the "Good Agricultural and Environmental Condition" for the application of single area payments and certain rural development subsidies and the conversion rate of animals to livestock units. The purpose of this Regulation is that the minimum management and environmental requirements required by the European Union general acts of direct application for the application of the Good Agricultural and Environmental Condition required for the use of the aids covered by the cross-compliance system. and by identifying cases of non-compliance with these requirements, to ensure good agricultural and ecological status of agricultural land and to determine the conversion rates of animals to livestock units. The provisions of this Regulation shall apply to the following subsidies: a) European Agricultural Guarantee Fund and support for vineyard restructuring and conversion; b) European Agricultural Fund for Rural Development (EAFRD) for the source of the 2007-2013 programming period, the following grants provided under Council Regulation (EC) No. 1698/2005: (ba) aid for afforestation of agricultural land; (bb) agri-environmental support; (bc) aid for forest-environment measures; (bd) compensatory aid for farming in less-favored areas; (be) compensatory aid for the management of Natura 2000 grasslands; (bf) compensatory aid for the management of Natura 2000 forest areas; (bg) aid for the conservation of protected native and endangered livestock species in breeding; (bh) aid for the conservation of plant genetic resources (bi) support for the conservation of animal genetic resources; (bj) aid for animal welfare measures accompanying the restructuring of the dairy sector.

Policy: Regional Law No. 19-OZ “On procurement and collection of non-timber edible and non-edible forest resources and medicinal plants by citizens for individual personal needs”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates procurement and collection of non-timber edible and non-edible forest resources and medicinal plants by citizens for individual personal needs. Citizens shall be granted the right to procure the aforesaid resources, except for spruce and other coniferous forest species for New Year celebrations, freely and free of charge. Procurement of edible and non-edible non-timber protected forest species, plants, mushrooms, nuts and berries shall be prohibited. Regional Governor can fix specific periods of procurement of non-timber forest species. Procurement of wood forage shall be authorized from shots and branches of  hardwood and coniferous tree species. Procurement of birch juice shall be authorized from trees destined for timber extraction non sooner than 5 years before felling period.

Policy: Regional Law No. 20-OZ “On forest management for hunting purposes”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes the modalities of forest management for hunting purposes. Hunting management shall be considered entrepreneurial activity related to rendering of hunting services. Hunting grounds within forest areas shall be managed in accordance with forestry regulation and forest management project. Hunting managers shall have the right to: (a) carry out biotechnical arrangements; (b) have access to information related to forest parcels conceded for hunting management; and (c) keep and breed wild fauna species subject to hunting in semi-captive conditions. Hunting managers shall have the duty to: (a) manage forest parcels for hunting in compliance with acting legislation; (b) protect wild fauna; (c) prevent environmental damages; (d) preserve protective, recreational and other beneficial properties of forests; (e) timely pay lease fees; and (f) comply with sanitary, veterinary and zoohygienical requirements while treating wild fauna species.
Subject: Forestry, Wild species & ecosystems

There will be no replanting of exotic tree species in the legal reserve, after the initial planting production cycle, except in the case of small holdings.

Policy: Regional Law No. 12-RZ “On delimitation of plenary powers of state bodies in the sphere of forest relations”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law delimits plenary powers between the Regional Parliament and the Regional Government in the sphere of forest management, protection, conservation of forests, and also related to afforestation and reforestation. Regional Parliament shall have the following competence: (a) establishment of the modalities and rates of timber extraction for individual personal needs; (b) collection and harvesting on non-timber forest products by citizens; (c) use of forests for hunting; (d) establishment of exceptional cases for timber extraction in accordance with purchase and sale contract of forest species; and (e) legislative regulation in the sphere of forest relations. Regional Government shall have the following competence: (a) ownership, management and disposal of the plots of public forest; (b) establishment of rates of payment for a unit of timber and a unit of forest area; (c) acceptance of forest declarations; and (d) acceptance of afforestation and reforestation reports.

Timber extraction shall be performed in accordance with purchase and sale contract of forest species without allotment of forest parcels. Citizens shall be granted the right of free stay in the forests for the purpose of collection and harvesting of non-timber forest products.

Policy: Order No. 269 on discharge of waste from ships and platforms.
Policy_Content: This Order sets regulations on the discharge of waste from ships and platforms and applies to all ships regardless of size. Outside specific areas, discharge of all objects made of plastic, including synthetic ropes, synthetic fishing nets, plastic garbage bags and incinerator ashes from plastic products which may contain residues of toxic or heavy metals may not be dumped at sea. Food-waste may be discharged when ships are located more than 12 miles from the nearest land. Exception is made for the discharge of waste from ships when saving life at sea is necessary; the dumping of waste results from damage to a ship or its equipment, provided that prior to and after the damage there have been all reasonable precautions to prevent emissions or reduce it as much as possible marine pollution; and when accidental loss of synthetic fishing nets occur, provided that all reasonable precautions have been observed to avoid such a loss.

Policy: Order No. 268 on classification, transport and discharge of liquid substances carried in bulk.
Policy_Content: This Order sets regulations and restrictions to all ships dumping liquid substances in bulk. It does however not apply to warships or other ships owned or operated by a state, as long as the ship is used exclusively for non-commercial purposes. Hazardous liquid substances must be classified in X, Y and Z categories in order to for Marine authorities and other MARPOL convention countries to be notified of the evaluated risks thereof. Definitions are set in article 13 on allowed discharge of residue of X, Y and Z substances when: ships navigate on speed of min. 7 knots or at least 4 knots, if not on own power; the discharge is made below the water line at a rate which does not exceed the permissible speed calculated for the outlet; and the discharge is made at a distance of at least 12 miles from the nearest land and in water depths of less than 25 meters. If a tank having contained Category X substance has been unloaded, it must be cleaned before the ship leaves the harbour
Subject: Sea, Wild species & ecosystems, Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe
Entry into force notes: This Order enters into force on 1 May 2008.

Policy: Order No. 267 on oil discharge from ships.
Policy_Content: This Order sets regulations on oil discharge from ships (does not apply to warships or other ships owned or operated by the state, as long as they are used exclusively for non-commercial purposes). It includes detailed territorial definitions which are subject to this regulation. Should dumping at sea take place, the following criteria are applied: tankers located more than 50 miles from the nearest land; tankers proceeding en route; instantaneous rate of discharge of oil not exceeding 30 lt. per mile; total quantity of oil discharged into the sea for oil tankers delivered (registered) prior to 31 December 1979 and that does not exceed 1/15.000 of the total amount of the particular cargo and for tankers delivered after 31 December 1979, with 1/30.000 of the total quantity of cargo; tankers using a system of monitoring oil discharge and a scheme of gulleys, in adherence to rules 29 and 31 of the Maritime Authority B notification, Technical regulation for ship construction and equipment, Chapter XXI. Discharge of oil in Antarctic marine territories is not allowed, and vessels are required to pre-notify of their planned navigation and have an agreement on transportation and delivery of oil, subject to approval from Maritime Authorities or other EU authorities and institutes, or from other MARPOL convention countries.
Subject: Sea, Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe
Entry into force notes: This Order enters into force on 1 May 2008.

Policy: Order No. 270 on discharge of sewage from ships and platforms outside Danish territorial waters and the Baltic region.
Policy_Content: This Order applies to vessels with a gross tonnage less than 400 authorized to carry more than 15 individuals and vessels of 400 gross tonnage and above, located in or outside the EEZ, the Baltic region and/or outside Danish territorial waters - setting regulations in regard to the discharge of sewage from ships and platforms. Discharge of sewage may occur by approved facilities for the treatment of sewage and wastewater. The latter must previously be treated by disinfectants and discharged at a distance of at least 3 miles from any closest coast. Wastewater discharge must occur at a minimum of 12 miles for land. The Order adheres to MARPOL convention regulations.

Policy: Décret n° 2008-357 pris pour l'application de l'article L. 542-1-2 du code de l'environnement et fixant les prescriptions relatives au Plan national de gestion des matières et des déchets radioactifs.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret, pris pour l'application de l'article L. 542-1-2 du code de l'environnement, fixe les prescriptions relatives au Plan national de gestion des matières et des déchets radioactifs. Les déchets radioactifs sont classés en fonction de différents critères comprenant notamment la période et les niveaux d'activité des principaux radionucléides qu'ils contiennent, mais aussi leurs caractéristiques physiques et chimiques et leur origine. Les solutions de gestion développées pour les différentes catégories de déchets sont décrites en annexe au présent décret. Les déchets radioactifs sont inventoriés par l'Agence nationale pour la gestion des déchets radioactifs (ANDRA), sur la base d'une déclaration de chaque producteur ou détenteur de déchets radioactifs. Chaque producteur ou détenteur de déchets radioactifs précise dans sa déclaration les types d'entreposage utilisés, leurs durées de vie prévisionnelles et les capacités disponibles dans l'hypothèse où les solutions de gestion définitive de ces déchets sont encore à l'état de projet.

Policy: Stratégie de Croissance et de Réduction de la Pauvreté 2008-2011 (SNRP2).
Policy_Content: Suite à la dégradation continue de l’environnement économique, politique et physique du Tchad, le Gouvernement a entrepris de réviser la Stratégie Nationale de Réduction de la Pauvreté (SNRP1). La nouvelle Stratégie Nationale de Réduction de la Pauvreté (SNRP2) vise à réorienter les politiques économiques et financières du gouvernement en faveur du développement du PIB non pétrolier et la diversification de l’économie tchadien. Pour atteindre ces objectifs, la SNRP2 s’appuiera sur cinq axes stratégiques qui sont: 1) promouvoir la bonne gouvernance pour renforcer la cohésion sociale et l’efficacité des politiques, 2) créer un environnement favorable à une croissance économique robuste et diversifiée, 3) valoriser le potentiel de croissance du secteur rural, 4) faire des infrastructures un levier de la croissance, 5) valoriser les ressources humaines.

Policy: Regional Law No. 1-RZ “On rules and rates of timber extraction, procurement of edible and non-edible non-timber forest products and collection and harvesting of medicinal plants”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes that citizens shall have the right of timber extraction for individual personal needs for heating, housing construction and other in accordance with purchase and sale contract without allotment of forest parcels thereto. Application for timber extraction shall be submitted to the regional branch of the authorized state forest institution by 1 May of the current year, specifying the purpose of timber extraction, amount and type of forest species (coniferous, hard-wooded broadleaved, soft-wooded broadleaved). The aforesaid institution shall provide for allotment of felling area during snowless period. Timber extraction shall be carried out in the form of clear cutting and selective cutting. Citizens shall be granted the right to procure edible and non-edible non-timber forest products, including wild growing berries, nuts, mushrooms and other, and collection and harvesting of medicinal plants, free of charge and without any authorization.

Policy: Health Strategic Plan 2008-2015.
Policy_Content: The Health Strategic Plan (HSP2) is a national planning instrument with a sectoral approach applicable to the period 2008-2015. The long term vision of the Ministry of Health is to enhance sustainable development of the health sector for better health and well-being of all Cambodian, especially of the poor, women and children, thereby contributing to poverty alleviation and socio-economic development. Among the guiding principles for implementing actions in the health sector, the document includes social health protection, especially for the poor and vulnerable groups. To attain its objectives, the strategic plan defines some policy directions, which include: to reinforce health legislation and strengthen regulatory mechanisms, including for food safety and hygiene, to protect providers and consumers’ rights and their health; to implement pro-poor health financing systems, including exemptions for the poor and expansion of health equity funds, in combination with other forms of social assistance mechanisms; to promote quality of life and healthy lifestyles of the population by raising health awareness and creating supportive environments. The HSP2 characterizes strategic priorities for the health sector into two broader interrelated areas: 1) population health problems and essential services; 2) challenges in relation to functional areas of the health system. Goals are set out for these priority areas.

Policy: Decision No. 380/QD-TTg on the Pilot Policy on Forest Environment Service Charge Payment.
Policy_Content: This purposes of this Decision are: to create a basis for the formulation of a legal framework on the policy on forest environment service charge payment applicable nationwide for clearly define the interests, rights and obligations of Forestry Environmental Service (FES) charge payees and payers, social forestry, creating sustainable economic foundations for forest protection and development, environmental and ecosystem protection, raising quality service, particularly ensuring water sources for electricity generation, water supply and tourist business activities. The Decision prescribes service types; sender charge rates; FES charge management and use; rights and obligations of FES charge payees and payers; responsibilities of authorities at all levels and branches for the implementation of the FES charge payment policy. The duration of application of the pilot policy on FES charge payment will be two years, counting from the effective date of this Decision. The policy on FES charge payment is experimentally applied in Lam Dong, Son La, Dong Nai, Hoa Binh. Binh Thuan and Ninh Thuan provinces and Ho Chi Minh city.  The Regulation is divided as follows: General Provisions (Chap. I); Protection Forest Management (Chap. II); Protection and Development of Protection Forests (Chap. III); Use of Protection Forests and Benefit Mechanism (Chap. IV); Non-Business Funds for and Investment in Protection and Development of Protection Forests (Chap. V); Organization of Implementation (Chap. VI).

Policy: Act amending the Federal Maritime Jurisdiction Act.
Policy_Content: The present Act introduces some amendments to the Federal Maritime Jurisdiction Act in its consolidated version of 26 July 2002 (BGBl. I p. 2876). In particular, the Act adds, inter alia, article 7a establishing that ship equipment may be installed only if it complies with certain rules; therefore, it empowers the Federal Minister for Traffic, Construction and Urban Development to issue - even without the approval of the Bundesrat - Ordinances concerning ship equipment.

Policy: Infrastructure Australia Act 2008 (No. 17 of 2008).
Policy_Content: This Act establishes two public agencies, Infrastructure Australia and the Infrastructure Coordinator, defines its functions and powers and provides with respect to their organization. Infrastructure Australia has the primary function of providing advice to the Minister, Commonwealth, State, Territory and local governments, investors in infrastructure and owners of infrastructure on matters relating to infrastructure. It shall also provide advice on infrastructure policy issues arising from climate change and carry out various functions relating to development and monitoring of nationally significant infrastructure, including energy infrastructure and water infrastructure. The primary function of the Infrastructure Coordinator is to assist Infrastructure Australia in the performance of Infrastructure Australia’s functions.
Subject: Energy, Water

Entry into force notes: This Act enters into force on 9 April 2008.

Policy: Regulation on detailed conditions of supporting investments assuring clean and energy-efficient production.
Policy_Content: This Regulation of the Minister of Environment, which is composed of 12 paragraphs, establishes detailed conditions of subsiding investments relating to environmental protection, assuring clean and energy-efficient production, and saving raw materials. The following types investments can be supported: (1) changes of technology to eliminate or limit harmful effects to the environment; (2) changes of technology to limit demand on energy, water and raw materials, wit particular attention to reuse of different types of energy and limitation of wastes; (3) application of technology to save energy used in building objects; (4) application of devices used to eliminate or limit harmful effects to the environment.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries
