Policy: Law “On organic agriculture”.
Policy_Content: This Law regulates relations concerning production, storage, processing, transportation and trade of organic agricultural commodities and raw materials, and also lays down legal grounds for organic agriculture, sets forth mandatory requirements for circulation of organic agricultural commodities with a view of granting public support thereto, establishing the duties of the authorized state body in the aforesaid sphere. Organic agriculture shall be considered a special type of agricultural activity, which is most compatible with agroecosystems and implemented in accordance with the requirements of relevant technical rules and regulations. Organic agricultural commodities shall be considered: animal and vegetable products and raw materials produced or processed in conformity with the requirements of organic agriculture, as well as wild plants, whose circulation is set forth by technical regulations. Organic agricultural foodstuffs shall be destined for human consumption. Basic principles of organic agriculture shall be set forth as follows: (a) favorable conditions for conservation of biodiversity through selection of the best plant varieties and pedigree stockbreeding; (b) soil improvement and conservation of soil fertility; (c) use of the best available ecofriendly technologies and practices for processing of agricultural commodities; (d) elimination of environmental pollution, cessation of the use of synthesized chemicals, application of environmentally friendly technologies during agricultural activities; (e) harmonization of agricultural and livestock sectors; and (f) exclusion of hormones, hormonal drugs, as well as GMO, genetic engineering and other modern biotechnologies and methods of ionizing radiation from agricultural production.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Livestock, Environment gen., Food & nutrition, Cultivated plants
Keyword: Ecological production/organic production,Basic legislation,Ecofriendly products/ecofriendly processes,Agricultural commodities,Transport/storage,Processing/handling,Certification

Policy: Law No. 13 establishing the Special Fund for Technical Assistance and Rural Extension of the State of Roraima (FUNDATER-RR).

The purpose of FUNDATER-RR is to deal with the following matters: 1. development, feasibility, implementation and follow-up of plans, programmes and projects aimed at Technical Assistance and Rural Extension in the State of Roraima; 2. execution of works and services, directed to the renovation, maintenance and rehabilitation of building facilities, linked to the activities of the Technical Assistance and Rural Extension programmes; 3. re-arrangement of services for the Technical Assistance and Rural Extension; 4. co-participation, with scientific, educational and cultural entities (public or private) in the promotion of events that have the purpose of offering opportunities focused on the activities of Technical Assistance and Rural Extension, within the framework of SEAPA; 5. creation of regular internship programmes in the Municipalities of the State of Roraima, aimed at the exercise of Technical Assistance and Rural Extension activities, regulated by SEAPA; 6. development of actions aimed at the improvement and qualification of human resources.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development

Policy: Law No. HO-36-N on Control over Use and Preservation of Land of Armenia.
Policy_Content: This Law defines the issues of effective use of land, land protection, supervision over compliance with the requirements of land legislation, establishes the duties of supervising bodies, rights and responsibilities of the persons being inspected, the procedures for conducting inspections. It shall be applicable to use and protection of all land categories pertaining to land fund of the Republic of Armenia, regardless of the purposeful use thereof, right of ownership and (or) subjects exercising the right of use. The objectives of land use supervision and conservation shall be as follows: (a) ensuring the fulfillment of the requirements of the land legislation by the subjects of land relations; (b) ensuring compliance with the requirements, use restrictions, mandatory servitude, rules and regulations defined by the law related to the use and protection of land; (c) ensuring the specific use of land fund in accordance with land tenure, urban land use planning and zoning; (d) ensuring the prevention of arbitrary use of public and municipal land; (e) ensuring the implementation of national-territorial programs in the field of land resources management; (f) ensuring the collection of rent for the use of public and municipal land plots; (g) ensuring land tax collection; (h) ensuring protection of land boundaries, geodetic and other special information signs; (h) ensuring preservation and use of the fertile soil layer when carrying out works related to land disturbance; (i) ensuring implementation of specific programs for the development of new land areas; and (j) ensuring the restoration of the disturbed land and inclusion thereof in the economic turnover.
Subject: Land & soil

Policy: Regional Law No. 1650-OD “On forest management”.
Policy_Content: This Regional law regulates some issues related to forest management originating from timber extraction by natural and legal persons, procurement of non-timber products, edible forest resources and medicinal plants, and also hunting management. Citizens shall have the right to timber extraction for heating, housing construction and repairs at the following rates: (a) for housing construction 25 cubic metres once in 50 years; (b) for repairs – 10 cubic metres once in 10 years; (c) for heating – 5 cubic metres annually; and (d) for other individual personal needs – 2 cubic metres annually. Timber extraction shall be carried out by citizens in accordance with forest management plan in the process of timber extraction intermediate and sanitary felling in accordance with purchase and sale contract of forest species concluded with state authorities. Felling of trees for procurement of non-timber products shall be prohibited. Hunting management shall be organized on forest parcels allocated on lease to hunting management organization.

Policy: Regional Law No. 1650-OD “On forest management”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates relations in the sphere of forest management regarding timber extraction, procurement of fuelwood, non-timber forest resources, edible forest resources, medicinal plants and also hunting management. Citizens shall have the right to timber extraction of individual personal need for payment of fees for the following purposes and in accordance with the following rates: (a) for housing construction and construction of dependency outbuilding –25 cubic metres once in 50 years; (b) for repairs and reconstruction of housing facilities –10 cubic metres once in five years; and (c) fuelwood for heating –five cubic metres annually. Citizens must conclude purchase and sale contract of forest species (art. 1). Felling of trees for procurement of birchbark and other non-timber forest resources shall be prohibited (art. 2). Procurement of edible non-timber forest resources shall be carried out so as to ensure timely reproduction of the aforesaid resources (art. 3). Allotment of forest parcels pertaining to protected areas, protection forests and afforestation and reforestation areas for hunting and captive breeding of wild fauna species shall be prohibited. Lease holder of forest parcels allotted for hunting purposes shall have the right to organize various types of hunting, keep and breed wild fauna species for hunting purposes and carry out acclimatization arrangements (art. 5).

Policy: Decree on soil pollution by waste input.
Policy_Content: This Decree lays down the conditions related to the loading of soil by the introduction of waste and the obligatory conduct in the planning and implementation of the introduction of earth excavation or artificially prepared soil in order to improve the ecological condition of that soil. For the purpose of this Decree, the improvement of the ecological condition of soil is the introduction of earth excavation or artificially prepared soil into or on the soil due to its reclamation, backfilling of land when establishing a new soil condition or due to filling excavations due to restoring the original soil condition; reclamation is a measure to restore soil fertility. This Decree shall not apply to the management of waste mineral raw materials, waste sediments and excavations that are so contaminated with hazardous substances that, in accordance with the regulation governing waste management, they are classified as hazardous waste. This Decree also determines the conditions for the use of construction materials prepared from treated or untreated, source or waste mineral raw materials, if hazardous substances may start to leach upon contact with rainwater, groundwater or surface water.

Policy: Regional Law No. 1439-KZ “On forest management for hunting purposes”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes rules for forest management for hunting purposes, specifying that management of forest parcels shall be regulated by lease contracts of forest parcels. Leaseholder must present to the lessor forest management plan within a year from the date of state registration of lease contract. Leaseholder carrying out hunting management on forest parcels shall have the right: (a) to keep and breed wild fauna specie destined for hunting under semi-captive conditions; (b) to carry out biotechnical arrangements (create feeding grounds, sow fodder plant species, creation of artificial nesting points, cover for wild animals and birds); and (c) to construct provisional structure for hunting purposes. Forest managers shall have the following duties: (a) to carry out hunting management in compliance with acting legislation; (b) to ensure the right of citizens for free stay in forests; (c) to ensure protection of wild fauna species and protection of habitats; and (d) to compensate losses caused to forestry.

Policy_Content: La présente loi s’applique, conformément au droit international, aux rejets de substances polluantes dans: a) les eaux intérieures, y compris les ports, d’un Etat membre de la Communauté européenne, dans la mesure où le régime MARPOL est applicable; b) les eaux territoriales d’un Etat membre de la Communauté européenne; c) les détroits utilisés pour la navigation internationale soumis au régime du passage en transit, dans la mesure où un Etat membre de la Communauté européenne exerce une juridiction sur ces détroits; d) la zone économique exclusive, ou une zone équivalente, d’un Etat membre de la Communauté européenne, établie conformément au droit international et e) la haute mer. La présente loi s’applique aux rejets de substances polluantes provenant de tout type de navire, quel que soit son pavillon. Le texte comprend 12 articles comme suit: Définitions (1); Champs d’application (2); Infractions (3); Sanctions (4); Exceptions (5); Responsabilité des personnes physiques (6); Complicité (7); Compétence juridique (8); Conformité avec le droit international (9); Notifications d’informations (10); Point de contact (11); Circonstances atténuantes (12).

Policy: Ports Authority Regulations (6.01).
Policy_Content: These Regulations provide for control over ports and sets out rules relative to navigation, port activities and related matters. They also prohibit the pollution of territorial waters and the air. All vessels and all persons using the facility of the Ports Authority shall take every precaution to avoid pollution of the air. The Director of Ports may order the removal from port of any vessel which has on board cargo or other matter injurious to health or offensive or dangerous in any respect and such cargo or matter shall be disposed of in such manner as the Director of Ports may order at the risk and expense of the vessel. Vessels having on board goods of a dangerous or inflammable nature shall, at least twenty-four hours before arrival, give notice thereof to the Director of Ports. If such goods are landed without permission, the Director of Ports may order them to be placed on board the vessel whence they came or otherwise deal with the goods as he considers necessary at the risk and expense of the vessel.  The Ports Authority reserves the right to accept or refuse cargo which may be considered dangerous to person or property.

Policy: Regional Law No. 17-ZO “On forest management”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes the modalities, rules and norms of some types of forest management. Citizens shall be granted the right to timber extraction for individual personal needs without trade or re-sale thereof. Individual personal needs shall be considered: (a) housing construction; (b) repairs of residential facilities; and (c) heating of residential facilities. Citizens shall carry out timber extraction in accordance with purchase and sale contracts for forest species. In areas of traditional living and economic activity of indigenous small ethnic communities of the North, Siberia and the Far East of the Russian Federation they shall be granted the traditional rights of timber extraction for individual personal needs within established rates free of charge. Collection of fuelwood shall be authorized in the areas of burnt forest and windfall timber.

Policy: Competition Act, 2007
Policy_Content: This Act is made to apply to all economic activities within the country or having effect in the country with the exception of trade practices which exercise exclusive trading privileges conferred by a government agency or law and trade practices which are associated with the licensing of participants in certain trades by agencies of the government or in accordance with authority by a law. The Act establishes the Competition Commission and grants it legal personality, provides for its composition and charge it with the authority to monitor, regulate and control acts which adversely affect competition in business within the country. Essentially, the Commission is to provide information for the guidance of consumers regarding their rights, inform business about their rights, take expedient actions to regulate the creation of mergers and address the abuse of a dominant position by an enterprise, among others. The Act outrightly prohibits anti-competitive trade practices, including agreements to fix prices, market and customer allocation agreements, collusive tendering and bid rigging, predatory pricing, discriminatory pricing, etc.

Policy: Arrêté du 28 juillet 2005 relatif à la vérification et à la quantification des émissions déclarées dans le cadre du système d’échange de quotas d’émission de gaz à effet de serre.
Policy_Content: Le présent arrêté définit: les modalités de surveillance de l'installation qui émet des gaz à effet de serre, les modalités de mise en oeuvre des obligations particulières de quantification des émissions de gaz à effet de serre, auxquelles sont soumis les exploitants pour les activités désignées à l'article R. 229-5 du code de l'environnement, la procédure relative à la transmission, par voie électronique au préfet, de la déclaration annuelle des émissions de gaz à effet de serre au titre du système d'échange de quotas, accompagnée du rapport de vérification établi par un organisme vérificateur agréé, les conditions dans lesquelles des organismes peuvent recevoir un agrément pour la vérification des déclarations d'émissions de gaz à effet de serre mentionnées au III de l'article L. 229-14. Il fixe aussi les exemptions applicables aux installations dont les émissions déclarées moyennes vérifiées sont inférieures à 25 kilotonnes de CO2 par an pendant la période d'échanges précédente.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Environment gen.

Policy: Forestry Regulation of state nature biosphere reserve “Sihote-Alinskiy”.
Policy_Content: This Forestry Regulation establishes the following authorized forest uses on the territory of state nature biosphere reserve “Sihote-Alinskiy” of national significance composed predominantly of protection forests: (a) timber extraction as selective felling for sanitary purposes and removal of debris and windfall; (b) collection of non-timber forest products by the staff ; (c) tourism for educational purposes; (d) recreational use of specifically selected areas; (e) hunting and collection of wild flora species for scientific research purposes in accordance with special permits issued by the Federal Nature Management Supervision Service; and (f) forest fire preventive and forest fire extinguishing arrangements. Procurement of soft resin on the territory of nature biosphere reserve shall be prohibited. Collection of seeds, flowers and other types of management of wild flora on the territory of nature biosphere reserve shall be prohibited.

Policy: Forestry Regulation of state nature biosphere reserve “Barguzinskiy”.
Policy_Content: This Forestry Regulation establishes the following authorized forest uses on the territory of state nature biosphere reserve “Barguzinskiy” of national significance: (a) timber extraction (as miscellaneous felling) used for the needs of reserve and its staff; (b) collection of non-timber forest products by the staff and by the population living within the boundaries of reserve; (c) tourism for educational purposes; (d) scientific and experimental research activity; (e) hunting and collection of wild flora species for scientific research purposes; and (f) forest fire preventive and forest fire extinguishing arrangements. It establishes norms and rates of authorized timber extraction, forest species subject to timber extraction and age of standing timber subject to felling. It also specifies extension of felling area, annual norms of authorized procurement of soft resin and annual allowable amount of collection of non-timber forest products. The period of validity of this Forestry Regulation shall be 10 years.

Policy: Política Nacional de Seguridad Alimentaria y Nutricional. Documento CONPES Nº 113.
Policy_Content: La Política Nacional de Seguridad Alimentaria y Nutricional es un instrumento sectorial de alcance nacional, enmarcado en el Plan Nacional de Desarrollo, cuyo objetivo general es el de garantizar que toda la población colombiana disponga, acceda y consuma alimentos de manera permanente y oportuna, en suficiente cantidad, variedad, calidad e inocuidad. La Política está dirigida a toda la población colombiana y busca contribuir a la disminución de las desigualdades sociales y económicas, asociadas a la inseguridad alimentaria y nutricional, en los grupos de población en condiciones de vulnerabilidad. Por este motivo, se priorizan acciones hacia los grupos de población más vulnerables, como son los desplazados por la violencia, los afectados por los desastres naturales, los grupos étnicos (indígenas, afrocolombianos, raizales, gitanos), los niños, las mujeres gestantes y las madres en lactancia, y los grupos de personas y campesinos de más bajos recursos.

Policy: Lineamientos de política para promover la producción sostenible de biocombustibles en Colombia. Documento CONPES Nº 3510.
Policy_Content: Los Lineamientos de política para promover la producción sostenible de biocombustibles en Colombia, tiene como Objetivo General aprovechar las oportunidades de desarrollo económico y social que ofrecen los mercados emergentes de biocombustibles, de manera competitiva y sostenible. Son sus Objetivos específicos: 1) Incrementar competitivamente la producción sostenible de biocombustibles, contribuyendo a la generación de empleo, al desarrollo rural y al bienestar de la población; 2) Promover una alternativa de desarrollo productivo para la ocupación formal del suelo rural; 3) Contribuir a la generación de empleo formal en el sector rural; 4) Posicionar al país como exportador de biocombustibles a partir de la consolidación de esta agroindustria como un sector de talla mundial; 5) Diversificar la canasta energética del país mediante la producción eficiente de biocombustibles, haciendo uso de las tecnologías actuales y futuras; 6) Garantizar un desempeño ambientalmente sostenible a través de la incorporación de variables ambientales en la toma de decisiones de la cadena productiva de biocombustibles.

Policy: Presidential Decree No. 9/2008 ratifying the Kyoto Protocol to the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change.
Policy_Content: This Resolution ratifies the Kyoto Protocol to the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change. Each Party included in Annex 1, when fulfilling its quantified emission limitation and reduction commitments, in order to promote sustainable development, must: a) Implement and/or improve policies and measures according to their national circumstances, such as: i) Increasing energy efficiency in relevant sectors of the national economy; ii) Protection and increase sinks and reservoirs of greenhouse gases not controlled by the Montreal Protocol, taking into account its commitments made in relevant international agreements on the environment, the promotion of sustainable forest management, afforestation and reforestation practices; iii) Promote sustainable forms of agriculture in the light of climate change considerations; iv) Research, promotion, development and increased use of new and renewable forms of energy, carbon dioxide sequestration technologies and environmentally safe technologies, which are advanced and innovative; v) Gradual reduction or elimination of market imperfections, tax incentives, tax and tariff exemptions and subsidies for all sectors emitting greenhouse gases that are contrary to the objective of the Convention and the application of market instruments; vi) Encourage adequate reforms in relevant sectors, with a view to promoting policies and measures that limit or reduce greenhouse gas emissions not controlled by the Montreal Protocol; vii) Measures to limit and/or reduce greenhouse gas emissions not controlled by the Montreal Protocol in the transport sector; viii) Limitate and/or reduce methane emissions through its recovery and use in the treatment of waste, as well as in the production, transport and distribution of energy.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Central Africa, Least Developed Countries, Small Island Developing States
Entry into force notes: This Presidential Decree enters into force immediately.

Policy: Regional Law No. 418-OZ “On forest management for hunting purposes”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes rules for forest management for hunting purposes, specifying that hunting shall not cause forest productivity, deteriorate sanitary state of forests and increase forest fire risks. Forest managers shall have the following rights: (a) to carry out biotechnical arrangements (create feeding grounds, sow fodder plant species, creation of artificial nesting points, cover for wild animals and birds) in accordance with forestry regulations; and (b) to construct provisional structure for hunting purposes (hides, traps etc.). Forest managers shall have the following duties: (a) use forest fund land so as to ensure ecosystem preservation, prevent soil degradation, pollution, littering and disturbance; and (b) carry out forest fire prevention arrangements.

Policy: Mines and Minerals Development Act, 2008 (No. 7 of 2008).
Policy_Content: This Act makes provision with respect to large-scale, small-scale and artisanal mining and relative rights of exploration, exploitation and processing of mineral resources. Further provisions of this Act concern, among other things, use of water, surface rights, environmental protection and administration.
